652408245.name: There are no words!
652408245.author: a TripAdvisor user
652408245.reviewBody: The building is stunning! The gardens are an oasis of heaven on earth! But I really wanted to go to Confession (hadn\'t been in 10 years) with Fr Basil after I heard how marvelous he was (at the nail shop!) I Am getting choked up remembering how kind, gentle and gracious he was with me, he as like balm on my aching heart! I went to the 9:00 English mass afterwords and it was just wonderful, lots of my favorite music, great choir! Highly recommend whether you RC or not, then spend the morning in the plaza sipping coffee and chatting with \'Mexpats\' and natives! High-lite of my trip!

650005720.name: What can you say?
650005720.author: a TripAdvisor user
650005720.reviewBody: Such a beautiful church. It was always busy and lots of ceremonies going on, always felt welcomed. \nFelt very welcomed there

617918302.name: Very beautiful church dedicated to St. Andres, patron saint of Chapala.
617918302.author: a TripAdvisor user
617918302.reviewBody: This is a beautiful church and has lovely morning bells that may be heard all over town. At the very end of the street/highway (Guadalajara/Chapala highway). Beautifully decorated at Los Dias De Los Meuretes, Oct 31st - Nov 2nd. This is a very attractive architectural and religious gem at the lakes edge and all visitors should take a peek at it if at all possible.

604054924.name: There is always something happening at this church
604054924.author: a TripAdvisor user
604054924.reviewBody: Went there for Easter .. Wow that was something.  Including the whipping.  Was with all the locals that all believe that this is a magical time of year.  I believed it too.  Walked to the top of the mountain with this well built Jesus.  The church is the place to be.. If you visit and stay close to the church don\'t expect to sleep much between Nov-Jan 7 lots of fireworks there.  Relax and enjoy.

602807387.name: Keeping the faith!
602807387.author: a TripAdvisor user
602807387.reviewBody: Charming little church was starting mass shortly after we arrived.   It\'s a lovely peaceful place.  It doesn\'t take a long time to see it all.   Try to find the 1520 marker!

600115812.name: Peace and Character
600115812.author: a TripAdvisor user
600115812.reviewBody: Ajijic is a town with a lot of great artists and paintings. But the historical art exists as well the Church is a good sample of it. Enter it enjoy the peace, indulge yourselfe in the architecture and take the time to reflect for yourself

560850468.name: Lovely small church
560850468.author: a TripAdvisor user
560850468.reviewBody: This church is located near the town center plaza. It was decorated in an unusual way for  the Day of the Dead celebration.

558148802.name: Nice
558148802.author: a TripAdvisor user
558148802.reviewBody:
This Catholic church is famous for its reenactments of the crucifixion at Easter time.  If you can here for Easter weekend, I think it would be quite something to witness.

Some describe it as a Colonial church dating back to when missionaries came to the area to teach Christianity.

If you would like to attend, English mass is said on Sunday morning at 9am.

I have read that the church is often locked up.  We walked by on a Thursday morning and were able to get inside.  Later on in the afternoon though, it was locked up again.

555674790.name: This just right near the plaza
555674790.author: a TripAdvisor user
555674790.reviewBody: This church is very nice.  Right across the street is a GREAT coffee place. You can get a variety of coffees that come from various regions of Mexico.  We met a couple at a local nursery who drive from Guadalajara every Sunday to have their coffee there.

552935691.name: Lovely colonial church off main square
552935691.author: a TripAdvisor user
552935691.reviewBody: Typical of any small town, the church is at the center. There was a wedding going on while we visited, very festive, lots of flowers and music. Lot\'s of history here

539846154.name: Always the center of all towns in Mexico
539846154.author: a TripAdvisor user
539846154.reviewBody: Lovely church in Ajijic center.  You can be sure to always find  something happening.  A local favorite church.

533575834.name: cathdral off the village square
533575834.author: a TripAdvisor user
533575834.reviewBody: once again as are many things in this area this is a very intresting piece of the past for ajijic and surrounding area, the church is very old not sure just how old but, sundays are an event, this large cathdral is packed, relgion is an important part of mexicans every day life and this shows it, the church id right off the village square and easy to get to, mass on sunday starts at 8:00 and goes all day, however there is only one english mass at 9:00

501393035.name: BEAUTIFUL COLONIAL CHURCH
501393035.author: a TripAdvisor user
501393035.reviewBody: This church is at least the third main church built in the village. The first was a wooden structure in the 1500s that burned down. I am told that the small stone church in the Ajijic plaza (Our Lady of the Rosary) was the second church built but the villages population soon outgrew it. It is still used at certain times and the English-speaking Catholic community uses it in Holy Week every year. Today\'s main church (templo in Spanish) was built around 1754. It is quite beautiful and very clean. It is on its own plaza near the main plaza and hosts a spectacular Passion Play every year at the end of Lent. The English-speaking community celebrated Mass every Sunday at 9 am with a wonderful choir of local Mexicans and expats. The congregation meets after the Sunday Liturgy for a brunch at a local restaurant and that is an excellent way to meet other foreigners who live in the area. There are many fiestas that make this church the focal point and celebrate with fireworks and "castillos" (Catherine Wheels).

487879459.name: Worth a visit
487879459.author: a TripAdvisor user
487879459.reviewBody: Went with friends. One was Catholic and was overwhelmed by the experience bringing back memories of his youth. Beautiful interior.

478252196.name: Beautiful Church
478252196.author: a TripAdvisor user
478252196.reviewBody: Another beautiful Roman Catholic church, not as ornate as a European one would be but very nice.  Easily accessible and close to the Jardine and Centro

472498145.name: Very understated..
472498145.author: a TripAdvisor user
472498145.reviewBody: We have tried several times to take visitors to this wonderful old church & so many of the times..it has been locked..at the gate..I would hate to think this is because of theft or vandalism..It is very charming..

469911639.name: Nice church with an English service.
469911639.author: a TripAdvisor user
469911639.reviewBody: We went to three churches during our trip to Jalisco. The Guadelupe church in PV, the catholic church in Tequila, and San Andres in Ajijic. This church was pretty average compared to the other two. I give it four stars because they had an English service.

467666485.name: Beautiful RC church
467666485.author: a TripAdvisor user
467666485.reviewBody: Charming. church in beautiful Ajijic for some reason it seems to exude tranquility. An English mass on Sunday\'s at 0900hrs. The people are very friendly and make you feel so welcome. Love seeing the little children so charming always seem to be smiling. Enjoy Mass at this church every Sunday during our stay in Mexico

457020378.name: heaven come to earth
457020378.author: a TripAdvisor user
457020378.reviewBody: In the middle of Ajijic is a classic Spanish Colonial Church. Gorgeous , as is all the others.  A great place to take a moment and sit before such beauty and reflect on where all that beauty has come from.   It breaks you out of the touristy mode and into peacefulness

454824158.name: Beautiful church
454824158.author: a TripAdvisor user
454824158.reviewBody: This church is just off the Plaza in Ajijic. It has many masses on Sundays, with an English 9 am Mass. Friendly people too.

449762601.name: Not Just A Little Pueblo Church
449762601.author: a TripAdvisor user
449762601.reviewBody: Definitely take a moment to see the inside of this charming church. Sit inside quietly, preferably toward the front. Lovely, lovely. If you are Catholic, or not, there is English mass with an excellent choir and a special priest with sacred messages at 9:00 a.m. Sunday. As you will read below, the church dates back to 1750. Village life revolves around it. On any given day you can witness baptisms, weddings, and funerals.

441184845.name: San Andres Catholic Church Ajijic
441184845.author: a TripAdvisor user
441184845.reviewBody: Beautiful church that captivates the skyline. Can be seen from wherever you are in Ajijic. Dates back to around 1750. There is a nice coffee shop just opposite that offers different types of coffee from different regions in Mexico.

436991221.name: Sacred.
436991221.author: a TripAdvisor user
436991221.reviewBody: A beautiful and magnificent church with wonderful history.  Spend some time in comfort and feel alive regardless if you\'re religious or not.

654634714.name: Try these!
654634714.author: a TripAdvisor user
654634714.reviewBody: So, Edgar has great tequila under the name of Bonanza.  Smooth and soft.  That\u2019s why I prefer a Mexican Martini (2shots, lime and a shake) over a Bulldog!

654198992.name: Good fun, great margaritas!
654198992.author: a TripAdvisor user
654198992.reviewBody: This is fun place to stop by after shopping or an afternoon walk on the malecon.    They have really great margaritas, and of course any other tequila drink you would like.   Not the cheapest in town, but the best is never the cheapest!  Salud!

568480591.name: Small but fun
568480591.author: a TripAdvisor user
568480591.reviewBody: Just a few barstools off a side street.  Only really have bottled beer and tequila but a nice spot to sit with friends and hang out near the lake and shopping.

565177605.name: The best margaritas in the town!!
565177605.author: a TripAdvisor user
565177605.reviewBody: this Saturday they will have live music !! It\'s worth going, Saturday March 10th from 4:00 to 7:00 pm I plan to go, they always do the best things ...

641447924.name: Normal
641447924.author: a TripAdvisor user
641447924.reviewBody: no esta muy bonito pero como ajijic en general es bien pintoresco me encanta el centro y el kioskito,,

636090716.name: Rodeado de obras de arte.
636090716.author: a TripAdvisor user
636090716.reviewBody: Adem\u00e1s del bello jard\u00edn que lo rodea, destaca una extraordinaria escultura efectuada en los restos de un tronco de \u00e1rbol.

615427419.name: El Coraz\u00f3n de Ajijic
615427419.author: a TripAdvisor user
615427419.reviewBody: En M\u00e9xico, todas las poblaciones grandes y peque\u00f1as tienen su "coraz\u00f3n", es decir, su plaza principal. En la mayor\u00eda de ellas existe un kiosko, que generalmente cumple m\u00faltiples funciones; pero la m\u00e1s importante, es la de congregar a los visitantes en torno a la m\u00fasica, un concierto, una presentaci\u00f3n y hasta a veces, un mitin. En Ajijic, la Plaza Principal con su kiosko no es la excepci\u00f3n y desde el amanecer hasta entrada la noche, el movimiento de la plaza conjuga personalidades, nacionalidades, edades y a todo aquel que quiere disfrutar del ambiente placero y pueblerino de Ajijic.

583983335.name: Un bonito paseo en el pueblo
583983335.author: a TripAdvisor user
583983335.reviewBody: Si estas en el pueblo de Ajijic pasear por la plaza y visitar el kiosco , al rededor hay restaurantes, neverias y algunas tiendas simpaticas.

659469212.name: Watching the Cream Of The Crop
659469212.author: a TripAdvisor user
659469212.reviewBody: Each day I watched the most beautiful children congregating outside this highly acclaimed school. They seemed to have wonderful social skills, interacting with each other and bypassing the technology that seems to preoccupy many teens. Their gathering outside the school did not disrupt the neighborhood nor cause any unhappiness amongst the closeby residents. Also, by that time, the early morning arrival and departure of the preschoolers and kindergarteners was smoothly over. This seems to be a wonderfully organized, well-run  educational institution.

631444894.name: The clay skulls that surround the school are memorable and breathtaking
631444894.author: a TripAdvisor user
631444894.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this in front of the church.  I just watched them light each and everyone up for the Dia de los Muertos.  This is a powerful way to honor people who have passed.  Please walk by the plaza to the Church and turn around and see the skulls.

619214001.name: Annual Balloon Regatta
619214001.author: a TripAdvisor user
619214001.reviewBody:
This local custom marks the end of Summer and beginning of the week-long Independence celebrations held on the local soccer field. Teams of families, friends and commercial entities team up to make these hot air balloons from colourful crepe paper and try to to launch them,  mostly successfully although unpredictable breezes can cause some to burn and crash.
The “globos” range in sizes and shapes from modest to some as tall as 30 feet and is a truly interesting afternoon for the family. Food, drinks and music add to the family carnival atmosphere.
Admission is free, but raffle tickets are available and encouraged to help defray costs. As always, parking is a problem in the village and the concrete seating in the stand reminds one to bring a cushion next year!
AivarsT

463446839.name: Good Indoor Lap Pool
463446839.author: a TripAdvisor user
463446839.reviewBody: It\'s warm for a lap pool,  but the only one around. Adults before 2 pm, kids after 4 pm. You must sign up for a month or more, picking your days and hours.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hidalgo 233 Col. Ribera De Pilar

659968616.name: A visit to Ajijic Cemetery
659968616.author: a TripAdvisor user
659968616.reviewBody: This cemetery is within walking distance of Hotel Danza Del Sol. If you are from the US, as I am, it will be an interesting contrast in cultures. I am used to cemeteries being neatly trimmed and sterile. This cemetery, with its bright colors and decorations, gives demonstration of the ongoing devotion and love of families for their loved ones. There is much artwork in Ajijic, and the cemetery is no exception.

650004893.name: Interesting!
650004893.author: a TripAdvisor user
650004893.reviewBody: Went by myself so found it a bit scary. It is very clean and well worth the visit.The grave sites are well attended and very interesting, well worth a visiit

640115102.name: Dia de los muertos
640115102.author: a TripAdvisor user
640115102.reviewBody: Beautiful. A unique experience, touching and memorable. Families and friends gather to honor their loved ones. Festive and poignant.

638695945.name: A visit to our Mexican friend\'s family plot
638695945.author: a TripAdvisor user
638695945.reviewBody: Nov 2 is my birthday and we always visit our Mexican friend\'s family plot. A very special day. I often think I should have part of my ashes interred here because I would be reassured that someone would always pray for me.

637327444.name: Visiting Ajijic Cemetery
637327444.author: a TripAdvisor user
637327444.reviewBody: This is a beautiful and peaceful spot to visit.  My son and I were on vacation in Ajijic a week after Day of the Dead festivities and the cemetery was full of flowers, presents and tributes to loved ones.

630192010.name: Day of the Dead(Dia de los Muertos) celebration
630192010.author: a TripAdvisor user
630192010.reviewBody: This is a must visit for everyone to begin to understand the Mexican culture regarding their beliefs about death. Deaths of family and relatives are celebrated by decorating their graves and holding vigil over them, even overnight, accompanied by food and beverages. Guided tours are available on the day, with a small charitable contribution.\nTo further understand the culture, one must also see the animated film \u201cCoco\u201d.\nAivarsT

603693300.name: Don\'t miss this cemetery helps you celebrate life and have a better understanding of Mexican Culture
603693300.author: a TripAdvisor user
603693300.reviewBody: I enjoyed this cemetery so much.  Gave me such an appreciation for a culture I love.  If you don\'t really get it stop here and think about how much people are loved and remembered in a totally different way than in the US  . Give Death a new look and appreciate this wonderland.

594709764.name: Beautiful Day of the Dead Tour
594709764.author: a TripAdvisor user
594709764.reviewBody: A Mexican lady who worked for the local government in Chapala gave us a tour of the Ajijic Panteon (cemetary) on the Day of the dead. The Mexican culture celebrates dead relatives by cleaning their graves, decorating them, bringing food and having a picnic and telling stories about dead family members. We learned many things about Mexican and foreigners buried in the Panteon. The government has changed and I hope others will have chance to do a similar tour in the future.

590050543.name: day of the dead
590050543.author: a TripAdvisor user
590050543.reviewBody: Mexicans revere their dead ..... on the day of the dead , Mexicans go visit their loved ones in the cemetery down the street from my house ...  the whole family goes and has a picknic on the graves ..... they play music and make offerings of the departed\'s favorite food and of course tequila .....they talk to them about what has happened to family and friends over the past year ...... there is lots of drinking  so be careful when leaving on foot or driving

580477327.name: Life in Proper Perspective
580477327.author: a TripAdvisor user
580477327.reviewBody: This quaint little cemetery is a good place to meditate upon:origin, meaning, morality and destiny. You learn more at a funeral than a wedding. It\'s in some places well tended and in others totally neglected. It\'s quaint and artsy all the way through. Enjoy a true anthropological and artistic experience.

574743178.name: Very colorful cemetery
574743178.author: a TripAdvisor user
574743178.reviewBody: I love going to cemetery\'s. They are very different in every country. It is a peaceful place to go and pray and think about our loved ones who have passed away

568957708.name: Calming quiet place
568957708.author: a TripAdvisor user
568957708.reviewBody: The cemetery is beautiful. The Mexican people have such respect for their loved ones. The location is easy to find and waking here is beautiful.

560523128.name: Charming and unusual
560523128.author: a TripAdvisor user
560523128.reviewBody: While I am not an expert on Mexican cemetery traditions we found this little cometary well worth the visit. The way of celebration life over death, with soccer balls, egg shell flowers, painted dogs brought tears to our eyes in a very good way.  Very colorful, and very positive, it is well worth visiting.  We did not feel we were trespassing, but were rather kindly allowed to pay our respects.

558424114.name: Very Festive
558424114.author: a TripAdvisor user
558424114.reviewBody: Ok, I don\'t usually make a point of visiting cemeteries but if you are walking by this place it\'s worthwhile going in to see all of the beautifully adorned tombs.  I have been told that the gates are often locked up so I guess we were lucky to be able to go inside.

554506063.name: A beautiful place to visit
554506063.author: a TripAdvisor user
554506063.reviewBody: Coming from the United States, I don\u2019t expect a cemetery to be filled with flowering trees, birdsong, colorful tributes, and music.  I love the celebration of life, both past and present, that we were privileged to see.

552303695.name: Very colorful and educational
552303695.author: a TripAdvisor user
552303695.reviewBody: My first trip to Mexican cemetery and worth the trip. Very colorful grave decorations and huge variety of markers. I was shocked and disappointed by how much trash was scattered about. Great for photos, lots of trees and flowers.

548764934.name: The Ajijic Cemetery is a Fascinating Place for a Stroll or Reflective Visit
548764934.author: a TripAdvisor user
548764934.reviewBody: Cemeteries in Mexico are much more joyous and colorful than those NOB.  I live near the Ajijic Cemetery, so I often walk through, looking at the decorations and reading the tombstones.  Such a wealth of colors and decorations celebrating the lives from babies to the elderly.  I highly recommend that everyone spend a few hours here absorbing the way Mexicans truly celebrate death as an integral part of life.

538392701.name: Day of the dead
538392701.author: a TripAdvisor user
538392701.reviewBody: Went on the evening of dia dos Muertes. Really crazy. Hundreds of families celebrating their dearly departed. Lots to see on any day.

533574975.name: worth the time to take a look
533574975.author: a TripAdvisor user
533574975.reviewBody: was going to the organic market on the west side of ajijic and happened on this cemetary quite by accident, decided to take a look glad i did, it\'s very old and intresting to see the diffrent grave markers and the way families respect thier departed family and friends, from a purely historical value i wouldn\'t miss it, but just as an insight into the culture of the people who have lived there definetly worth your time

519914054.name: Don\'t miss it
519914054.author: a TripAdvisor user
519914054.reviewBody: So worth stopping for a walk through. Very elaborate and colorful. The Mexicans really take care of their ancestors. I am told once a year, on Day of the Dead, they come and have a picnic on their ancestors graves so they can tell them about the families happenings the past year. It\'s beautiful and unique... be sure to bring a camera.

501387841.name: HOW DO YOU RATE A CEMETERY IN MEXICO?
501387841.author: a TripAdvisor user
501387841.reviewBody: Mexican village cemeteries are different in Mexico than cemeteries in the U.S., Canada or Western Europe. The graves are placed helter skelter throughout the property and there are tombs that are difficult to walk around. You definitely must be sure footed unless you stay on the main path--but then you miss the colorful statues, paintings and toys or an occasional beer bottle to help family to remember the deceased in the tombs. The cemeteries are owned by the government but they are filled with religious mementos. You see family religious patrons as statues and they represent the family\'s desire for their loved ones to be happy with God in heaven. They certainly do not expect the dead to play with the toys, soccer balls or to drink the beer. These "grave goods"are all symbols of their hope for their family\'s eternal happiness and represent the things that made the deceased happy in life. \n\nThere are two large flat stones in the back of the cemetery where you find the graves of the author Dane Chandos and his father. Chandos (pen name) was a British visitor who lived near Ajijic on Lake Chapala for 40 years and built the first inn (posada). He may have been the first foreigner living in the area. He died in the late 1940s in Guadalajara of TB and his father died within a year of Chandos\' death. The graves are near the chapel and nearly against the back wall. The foreign community owes much to this gentleman but his grave is a bit neglected except for an old inscription on the flat stone naming his books. "House in the Sun", his history of his life in the area and the interesting visitors from other parts of the world, can still be found sometimes on eBay. It is a fascinating account of life in the early 1900s for anyone visiting or living in the area.

488289691.name: A Day to Remember
488289691.author: a TripAdvisor user
488289691.reviewBody: It was our first Dia de Los Muertos since arriving in the Lakeside area. We were invited to join our friend Jose and his family at the cemetery. A moving experience and also a joyful scene observing everyone celebrating those who have passed. It was an honor to have been invited. A must see event

488064698.name: scary on Halloween!
488064698.author: a TripAdvisor user
488064698.reviewBody: went there on Halloween, they had shows and fireworks very fun but scary for the young kids, many cripts are decorated and very Mexican

465672151.name: wonderful cultural experience
465672151.author: a TripAdvisor user
465672151.reviewBody: beautiful decorations, food, mariachis, and also prayer times and open-air sermons.  we sent at the end of October, when everyone is busy celebrating the lives of their passed family and friends, in the company of family and friends.  layout is haphazard, but that makes it even more interesting, as huge tombs and little plots sit side by side.  an hour or so wandering and mingling is great, unless you stop for snacks

456284714.name: Very tranquil..& huge..
456284714.author: a TripAdvisor user
456284714.reviewBody: So much history..if only the head stones could talk...\nMany of the grave sites almost tell a story about the person that passed away..so many little personal items & trinkets placed close by..

455465348.name: Very unusual cemetery worth a visit.
455465348.author: a TripAdvisor user
455465348.reviewBody: We have never been to a Mexican cemetery before and it quite the experience. The dearly departed loved ones have elaborate and beautiful memorials. We were told music is common at the cemetery - the departed are still part of the family.

455286652.name: Well kept
455286652.author: a TripAdvisor user
455286652.reviewBody: This cemetery is fairly well kept. many nice flowers remembering loved ones, Some grave sites need attention. You can get around it fairly well.

452008688.name: Panteon Municipal
452008688.author: a TripAdvisor user
452008688.reviewBody: I don\'t normally think of a cemetery as a tourist to do, and nothing about this says it is a tourist site. However, it is an excellent example of a large Mexican cemetery with a wide variety of monuments, gravesites, etc. Everyone who is unfamiliar with Mexican burial customs should visit a Mexican cemetery at some time, but remember that this place is sacred to people, some of whom will be in the cemetery when you are.

429295027.name: Colourful
429295027.author: a TripAdvisor user
429295027.reviewBody: My first time in a Mexican cemetery. A world away from the northern Northern American countries. The culture is obvious in the display of every grave. The Day of the Dead" festivities will be amazing as well I am sure!

405271372.name: The day when the live ones reunite with the love ones, Day of the dead
405271372.author: a TripAdvisor user
405271372.reviewBody: It\'s a fiesta in the cementery, people getting   together with those that are gone.\nHaving a fiesta, eating and singing, really good experience been around.

398364103.name: Day of the dead. November 1/2
398364103.author: a TripAdvisor user
398364103.reviewBody: Amazing to witness the celebration of their loved ones who have passed. It is a sight to behold. Music for the passed muscians. Their favorite foods are laid out.\nGrooming and upgrades of the site are done at this time.

386164751.name: Best experienced during the Day of the Dead
386164751.author: a TripAdvisor user
386164751.reviewBody: I visited the cemetery to sit by the grave site of Jose Antonio Escamilla, the 17 year-old son of the Delegado (Administrator) of Ajijic,who had passed in less than 3 weeks after a diagnosis of leukemia. A sad loss for the family and community. I was there on a week day and only a caretaker was around. My photos are "quiet" as opposed to colorful. Best to see the cemetery on a weekend when families sit and eat breakfast with loved ones who have passed, or during the Day of the Dead celebrations, to get a better feeling of how important "los muertos" are to the locals.

382515817.name: Interesting for a brief visit
382515817.author: a TripAdvisor user
382515817.reviewBody: This listed as the #2 place to visit in Ajijic is puzzling.  The site to see is the town itself:  the plaza, the street vendors, the Sunday families picnicking by the lake.  The cemetery is well kept and a testament to the Mexican respect for family, though.

380030804.name: Interesting history of the area.
380030804.author: a TripAdvisor user
380030804.reviewBody: I come here to pay respects on the Day of the Dead. But I have gone back in the daytime as well. DoD is very unique. Respectful in nature, so caution with cameras and interfering with families unless you are invited. The local folk tolerate the intrusion with good humor for the most part. But I am always cautious as it is crowded, and not about me. Beautiful customs, color, and an eerie beauty.

378768574.name: pride of the village
378768574.author: a TripAdvisor user
378768574.reviewBody: The panteon is beloved by the villagers. There are several historic monuments. New lighting and walks have been added

370551631.name: Attractive and Interesting
370551631.author: a TripAdvisor user
370551631.reviewBody: The care with which the graves are taken care of is a pleasure to see.  Also the variety of gravestones, graves, architecture which has such a great variety\nand have been done with so much though.  Recommended particularly on or after the Day of the Dead on November 1.

368664770.name: Sobering
368664770.author: a TripAdvisor user
368664770.reviewBody: Cemeteries in general are sobering, and this one is no exception. It is interesting as to how much care and devotion \'is put into each grave. Perhaps, more than the survivors\' own living quarters. Truly a reminder of our own mortality and the degree to which the Mexicans\' revere  their families, even those who have passed on.\n\'

367218846.name: Lovely small town cemetery
367218846.author: a TripAdvisor user
367218846.reviewBody: Beautiful place for an "after life" event, a bit crowded but one gets served. Also nice for an afternoon stroll in "alive" modality and Picture taking

361887692.name: Looked like business was DEAD
361887692.author: a TripAdvisor user
361887692.reviewBody: Was walking by and it was very pretty and peaceful. I though I need to take some pictures of the Ajijic Cemetery as it had a lot of very pretty monuments, and the grounds were very well kept.

360767621.name: Visit with respect on November 1st (Day of the dead)
360767621.author: a TripAdvisor user
360767621.reviewBody: The Mexican people look at death a little different than North Americans do. They celebrate the life of their lost loved ones on this day. On November 1st you will see Mariachi bands playing, family\'s cooking and eating and sharing memories and drinks with their past loved ones. The cemetery comes alive this day with flowers galore! They welcome any visitor and if your here on Nov. 1st make it a must to to go and see. But please remember this is their culture and their tradition please be respectful, polite and humble. You never know you might be invited over to listen to the story of their lost loved one and have dinner with the family as I was.

349416225.name: A Gotta see on Day of the Dead!
349416225.author: a TripAdvisor user
349416225.reviewBody: I visited the cemetery on the day of the dead and took many photo\'s.  It was beautifully decorated and the many graves had their own special flowers and decorations for their loved one.

347218969.name: Night of the Day of the Dead
347218969.author: a TripAdvisor user
347218969.reviewBody: Visited the cemetery to observe the day of the dead celebrations, where families go to their ancestors\' graves and have a party with food and drink. Very dark and easy to take a bad fall; overall a bit creepy. Maybe in daylight not so bad....

343435498.name: A totally different experience
343435498.author: a TripAdvisor user
343435498.reviewBody: The Panteon is a riot of colour with large bouquets of artificial flowers covered in cellophane, tissue paper figures, hand written grave markers next to elaborate mausoleums.  It is a happy place, and often very busy with family members coming to visit.

337403582.name: Nice stroll for an afternoon\u2026.
337403582.author: a TripAdvisor user
337403582.reviewBody: Located on the west part of Ajijic. Interesting to walk through. Next year date of Day of the Dead- Nov 1, 2016. More maintained closer to Day of the Dead probably.

333800834.name: Wow!
333800834.author: a TripAdvisor user
333800834.reviewBody: First of all, we didn\'t visit this particular cemetery but one much closer to the village of Ajijic ... We had rented a golf cart for our stay here and doubt we could have walked there! Have never seen a brighter cemetery in any of our travels. The colors were amazing and the flora was out of this world. The poinsettia trees were blooming so beautifully and there were many other types of trees and flowers which were just stunning. Saw such beautiful memorials and tributes. Was very heartwarming to see how much care and pride is taken in the cemeteries. If the opportunity arises, visiting a cemetery here is a must!

330722098.name: day of the dead visit
330722098.author: a TripAdvisor user
330722098.reviewBody: Went Nov 1 for the day of the dead. There was a local tour and it was very interesting. Saw the grave of LA Rusa, famous Russian dancer. Also enjoyed the cultural shock of families picnicking in a cemetery.

330592445.name: The week after the day of the dead celebration
330592445.author: a TripAdvisor user
330592445.reviewBody: As we were walking we were wandering what was hidding behind these walls, as we got to the entry way, we realize that we had entered a cimetery, Wow!!!, we visited we realize that Mexican famillies take great pride of their deceased, great pride is given to the monument.

330068713.name: Day of Dead Celebrations
330068713.author: a TripAdvisor user
330068713.reviewBody: The cemetary is well maintained and on Day of Dead is decorated and frequented by hundreds of folks.  A great celebration of life.

328870225.name: have to see it to believe it
328870225.author: a TripAdvisor user
328870225.reviewBody: We stumbled upon this cemetery while taking a walk. It is like nothing we have ever seen. Colorful plastic flowers adorn wall to wall caskets all buried above ground , one can almost feel the celebration of life side by side with death. Worth a visit

326061450.name: Beautiful and touching for Day of the Dead
326061450.author: a TripAdvisor user
326061450.reviewBody: It was very touching to see how the Mexicans honor their loved ones that have passed. The beautiful flowers, pa\u00f1uelo de papel, special mementos that draw the spirits back were so personal and touching. The children\'s graves were precious and the families all there, honoring their loved ones made it a very special day for this gringo!

325792299.name: Great place to see on Day of the Dead
325792299.author: a TripAdvisor user
325792299.reviewBody: come here and see how families celebrate Day of the Dead. So colorful and touchingt to see the love and care shown at this time.

324743418.name: How do you rate a cemetery?
324743418.author: a TripAdvisor user
324743418.reviewBody: Not sure. We went to this one during the Day of the Day celebrations. This one is beautiful with gorgeously decorated graves. Be quiet and respectful. Don\'t take photos of a grave if a mourner is present without asking first. Smile and be glad you get to leave.

324531659.name: Dia de Muertes
324531659.author: a TripAdvisor user
324531659.reviewBody: This was an amazing experience to see the celebration each family had in the cemetery with their loved ones.  The flowers, respect, music, laughter and care taken to decorate on November 2 was extraordinary.  What a beautiful town with kind people and a lovely cemetery.

308562444.name: Old local cemetery
308562444.author: a TripAdvisor user
308562444.reviewBody: Interesting old Mexican cemetery but also "home" to many local legends such as La Japonesa and La Rusa. There are tours around the day of the dead, but interesting to just wander through alone at other times.

306369242.name: See Life Celebrated
306369242.author: a TripAdvisor user
306369242.reviewBody: Come visit for the Day of the Dead when the cemetery is decorated with shrines and families gather to celebrate LIFE. Locate west of Ajijic\'s downtown it is a must see if you visit in late October or early November.

282672091.name: Go, November 1.
282672091.author: a TripAdvisor user
282672091.reviewBody: When traveling through Mexico a must see is cemeteries in small towns.  Best time is after \'The day of the dead\' AKA  Holloween.  The presents left for the departed are very interesting as many were their favorite things when alive!

263121688.name: Very well maintained and lovely.
263121688.author: a TripAdvisor user
263121688.reviewBody: Due to our Delegado Hector Espana, our cemetery is well-maintained, private, spacious and a beautiful place to visit. It is worth the walk out on Hidalgo to get there.

263113649.name: Day of the Dead
263113649.author: a TripAdvisor user
263113649.reviewBody: Well kept family cemetery with beautiful decorations added to the gravesites during the Day of the Dead celebration

259026601.name: A place of nostalgia in a wonderful village
259026601.author: a TripAdvisor user
259026601.reviewBody: I spent a wonderful, tranquil, reverent day, on Dia de los Muertos, in a beautiful little village, named Ajijic.  It might sound a little morbid, spending a day in a cemetery.  But this is a very special day in Mexico, in a very special place, Ajijic.  The cemetery is jam packed with family and friends of their departed loved ones.  You see them eating various dishes, enjoying festive music of all types, crying and laughing, celebrating life and beyond.  You leave this cemetery filled with joy and sadness, sadness for the ones that have departed, and joy for the thought that we might be with them again, someday.

255589435.name: Worth a visit!
255589435.author: a TripAdvisor user
255589435.reviewBody: Not just for Day of the Dead (when it is an amazing experience with bands, picnikers and parties) this charming cemetery is worth an hour or two of your vacation.  Meticulously kept up, most plots give a real insight into the life and death of the occupant.  Lots of expats buried toward the bottom of the hill, many with very touching inscriptions.  We were there on Valentines and were touched by all the decorations and flowers.

253102182.name: Mexican Color Continues
253102182.author: a TripAdvisor user
253102182.reviewBody: What a wonderful cemetery complete with colorful displays of love, sadness and life. Must see for all!

246863795.name: Very interesting view of Mexican culture
246863795.author: a TripAdvisor user
246863795.reviewBody: We stopped by on Day of the Dead.  It was of course crowded and oddly festive (from an American perspective), an amazing glimpse of Mexican culture.

245161152.name: Historial
245161152.author: a TripAdvisor user
245161152.reviewBody: This is worth a stop.  Take a half hour to stroll through the varied monuments of both Mexican and others from the Us and Canada.

241710826.name: Visiting Ajijic\'s cemetery.
241710826.author: a TripAdvisor user
241710826.reviewBody: Being there over Day of the Dead was both interesting and fun.  The cemetery was full of families bringing flowers and celebrating the lives of their loved ones.

670277064.name: Evening walks
670277064.author: a TripAdvisor user
670277064.reviewBody: This is a must-do at least once a day. It\u2019s a happy place. Chance to stroll and eat ice cream. Families and lovers frequent the malecon. It is very safe. Also little souvenirs market.

667844709.name: Nice waterfront to relax, places to enjoy a beer
667844709.author: a TripAdvisor user
667844709.reviewBody: I enjoyed spending a few hours here. Walked along waterfront, had a beer at a bar. Lots of families, children swimming although I personally wouldn\u2019t trust the water. Serene atmosphere with nice views. Not much shade so bring a hat.

667257466.name: They certainly have made this much nicer
667257466.author: a TripAdvisor user
667257466.reviewBody: Today went to the malecon where we had parked the car.  Booths were being set up for Semana Santa holidays. They even had modern porta potties.  They have come a long way.   Walking along the Malecon is a lovely thing to do.  Enjoy the lake and the families who also appreciate this pretty location.

665244609.name: A nice walk by the lake
665244609.author: a TripAdvisor user
665244609.reviewBody: Most days their are vendors andr entertainers.  It is a great mix of locals and expats and a nice way to spend time outside.  Very safe during the day.  Probably would avoid after dark.

662554355.name: Ajijic Malecon
662554355.author: a TripAdvisor user
662554355.reviewBody: Ajijic has a beautiful Malecon that stretches about 3/4 of a kilometer.\nThe walk along the shore of Lake Chapala also gives you great views of the mountains to the North. At the East end you will come upon some stalls selling goods and a few restaurants. There are numerous benches along the way just to sit and enjoy the scenery.

661728361.name: Worth a saunter
661728361.author: a TripAdvisor user
661728361.reviewBody: Nice view of the lake and if you feel like walking, easier on your feet than the cobblestone streets in town. Sometimes there are local dancers or other performers.

661191769.name: Lovely to walk along
661191769.author: a TripAdvisor user
661191769.reviewBody: Has one very busy area with playground and picnic tables, walk further and it is all quiet and lovely gardens and sculptures. A few vendors and shops along the way. Lots of families in the one area.

659330491.name: A very good experience
659330491.author: a TripAdvisor user
659330491.reviewBody: We came here 2 times this past weekend to enjoy a nice walk on the Malecon in Ajijic.  We really enjoyed our walk - the whole length and back.  First we did it after dark and then the next day in the earlier evening when it was still light.  A lot of people this weekend, but the Malecon is very nice.  The water level is high so that makes it quite beautiful and interesting.

656161433.name: A Wonderful Sunday Afternoon
656161433.author: a TripAdvisor user
656161433.reviewBody: We added our names to the Ajijic Tango restaurant list and then walked down towards the lake to see what was doing at the Malecon./ Itr was a big celebration in honor of the Holiday of the Kites and not only were the guitarists and bands out playing, but the vendors were a plenty with wonderful offerings of fruits, cheeses, wines, beaded collections, clothing and handicrafts. It was a vast display of Mexican contemporary and artistic life. And of course, no can be more charming than an Ajijic salesperson. So you buy and buy and buy.

654592153.name: This is a little gem; have patience for parking and enjoy the color and the water
654592153.author: a TripAdvisor user
654592153.reviewBody: I was impressed with this tiny malecon; it is NOT large and the narrow streets make driving an american style SUV pretty tough.  However, I did like the color, the nature and it was fun hearing so much English being spoken.

650207513.name: One of the worst in town
650207513.author: a TripAdvisor user
650207513.reviewBody: I tried this place 3 time, each one worst than the other. And you might wonder why I kept going. I wanted to give them a second chance. 3 was enough. Also a friend that worked there told me there cleaning and food management standards are way way below save a acceptable, he said never to eat there again. So unless they change management I say that\'s a no go

647549509.name: Sunset Strip
647549509.author: a TripAdvisor user
647549509.reviewBody:
The Ajijic malecon is a great place to walk at any time and the best place in town to see the sunset.

There are a couple places to have a snack or cocktail at the beginning of the boardwalk, but be sure to walk to the very end where the lovely international peace garden is located.

You’ll hear a lot of English on the main shopping streets and central plaza of Ajijic. The malecon feels a bit more like Mexico as this is where local families come to picnic, party and play.

If you are traveling with small children, they will enjoy the extended park and play equipment. Skateboards, bikes and rollerskate are welcome. So are your four-legged friends.

646447492.name: Relax!
646447492.author: a TripAdvisor user
646447492.reviewBody: The malecon is a comfortable half kilometre walk along the lakeshore. It is an accessible spot for those who need it. There are many who use it as a smooth place to jog or cycle. There are many benches to rest and enjoy the lake scenery.

641665634.name: Beautiful
641665634.author: a TripAdvisor user
641665634.reviewBody: It is a long boardwalk, vibrant, full of life, very clean and with nice gardens, statues, a playground, and some amazing views.

639792349.name: Peaceful
639792349.author: a TripAdvisor user
639792349.reviewBody: Nice walkway along lake. Lots of benches.Treed park. Very well kept and clean. People flock on Sundays with families

639457337.name: The place to be in late afternoon
639457337.author: a TripAdvisor user
639457337.reviewBody: The Malecon, or lakeside promenade, is where folks walk their dogs, jog or sit and enjoy the view of the lake.  There are some food stalls at the entrance (look for the yellow food truck - best shrimp tacos in town), and further down, there is skateboarding and a volley ball court.  A soccer field sits at the end.

638989487.name: wonderful place for an evening or morning stroll.
638989487.author: a TripAdvisor user
638989487.reviewBody: I love this place and walk down it several times a week as I live here.   It\'s especially delightful on weekends and weekend evenings when there are all sorts of families, groups, young people, old people, babies, sometimes bands, you never know what. Sunsets are spectacular.  The best coffee house in town is at the eastern end at the foot of Colon. It\'s called Casa del Cafe. Closed on Tuesdays. Best Latte I\'ve ever had.

632655466.name: Nice walk about
632655466.author: a TripAdvisor user
632655466.reviewBody: Lots to see and buy and eat in that area.  Everything is so resonable and people very friendly.   So many expats from the states and canada that you feel like you are home.

631443709.name: Visit early in the morning or evening and you will get the best photos of your life.
631443709.author: a TripAdvisor user
631443709.reviewBody: No matter when you visit this is a beautiful stroll.  On Sunday you will enjoy the families visiting and enjoying each other. The local art near the basketball court will overwhelm you It will surprise you. Young talented men and women have spay painted work.  And now as you are taking pictures you have the new Ajijic sign to stand in front of .  This is a must when you come.

629946434.name: Too many Gringos
629946434.author: a TripAdvisor user
629946434.reviewBody: If you want a slice of anywhere USA or Canada Ajijic is the place for you. Older gringos and gringas (I\u2019m 65) with jewelry and...well you get the picture. Yes there are cobbled streets and quaint places but I was not impressed at all. There is so much more to see and do here and in M\u00e9xico but if you need the fellowship of English speaking folks this is for you...or you could stay home.

627078502.name: Best on a Weekday Morning
627078502.author: a TripAdvisor user
627078502.reviewBody: I like to feel as though I have Lake Chapala all to myself so I recommend early mornings on a weekday for a visit. On the weekends the malecon is full of dogs, kids racing bicycles or kids skate boarding, families from Guadalajara eating or walking in groups of four to ten.

627025290.name: Discovered Bobby\'s!
627025290.author: a TripAdvisor user
627025290.reviewBody: A living legend and a gourmet chef. Best dinner ever! Small and intimate, the ambiance is perfect. Plus home made ice cream!

621640363.name: Great and safe place to take a walk along the lake front
621640363.author: a TripAdvisor user
621640363.reviewBody: This is a popular place to walk your dogs.There are also  many park benches along the boardwalk to relax and watch the water birds. Palm trees and other exotics run along both sides of Malecon

617265491.name: Nice place for a walk
617265491.author: a TripAdvisor user
617265491.reviewBody: We walked along the malecon in Ajijic and the scenery is beautiful.  It\'s right along the lakeside, and you can see the mountains as well.  We didn\'t find much shade along the way, and it was a warm day on our walk.  Cool skate park but no one was using it at the time.

614472479.name: A pleasant place to walk
614472479.author: a TripAdvisor user
614472479.reviewBody: We walked the Malecon and ate at one of several restaurants in the area. There is a nice park with shade trees along the walk way. There were no activities when we were there but there often are activities.

613138017.name: Great walking
613138017.author: a TripAdvisor user
613138017.reviewBody: We walked the length of the Malecon during our recent visit to Ajijic. It was full of other walkers and families enjoying the views and the parks situated along the shore of Lake Chapala.

612441796.name: Jeff & Amy\u2019s Adventures
612441796.author: a TripAdvisor user
612441796.reviewBody:
Nice quiet waterfront with lots of families, couples and a few locals selling there wares/goods...... tried the roasted Mexican “crazy corn” Awesome!!!

Ajijic is a really laidback small Mexican town with lots of charm......artwork everywhere, on buildings, sidewalks, telephone poles and amazing area floral

Weather.....2nd best according to National Geographic 

30th of August, 72 at 3:00 in the afternoon with and expected low of 63

It was a heat index of 107 when we left DC

611006702.name: Favorite Place to Stroll
611006702.author: a TripAdvisor user
611006702.reviewBody: Cool breezes, great sunsets, perfect place for people watching. This is a favorite for locals as well as tourists. Very crowded on weekends.

603512763.name: Fun place to browse
603512763.author: a TripAdvisor user
603512763.reviewBody: This is a fun place to browse, especially on weekends. Many of the local artesanos have merchandise on display that can be purchased at reasonable prices. They will even make items for special order.

602803881.name: Stroll on the malecon
602803881.author: a TripAdvisor user
602803881.reviewBody: It seems to go on forever.  Beautiful view of the lake and mountains and plenty of friendly people along the way.

600503838.name: Chill out and enjoy
600503838.author: a TripAdvisor user
600503838.reviewBody:
After a nice dinner it is a lovely place to chill out and to meet with the locals . Sometimes there is a little market , music is on.
Good place to watch the sunset .
Experience it yourself ! 
You will like it

588084831.name: Peaceful, beautiful
588084831.author: a TripAdvisor user
588084831.reviewBody: During the week people walking, running, sitting on the many benches. Park on one side lake with mountains before you and mountains behind you. Weekends many families picnic on the park area. Some weekends there are stalls selling a variety of hand made treasures. The main shopping street Morelos is right there also. Good parking available right there. Get your car washed 40 pesos.

587691415.name: Wonderful Walking by Lake Chapala
587691415.author: a TripAdvisor user
587691415.reviewBody: The Malecon is kept clean by a bunch of workers and it is a great place to walk along the lake. There are benches if you want to sit and have a conversation and there are places that have shade for hotter days.

581826605.name: Artist Colony Malecon
581826605.author: a TripAdvisor user
581826605.reviewBody:
April 28, 2018 
Ajijic Malecon & Plaza

Originally an artist colony, Ajijic maintains lots of culture and art.  We parked by the lake and walked along malecon, up streets, stopping to shop of course, then onto plaza. The streets are colorful with many murals on building, many interesting doors so forth.  
The plaza has a beautiful gazebo with handcrafted ironwork.  A hand carved exquisite tree sets in the plaza as well.  Many functions of art or music occur there.  
Ajijic is a hustle and bustle of activity for natives and tourists along with a large expat colony.  
Some of the finer art galleries and shops are located in Ajijic.  
If you are visiting Lakeside Ajijic is a definite must see for its art and culture. Along with the mingling of tourists, expats and nationals.  
Shops, restaurants, local tiendas abound along the streets surrounding plaza.  The gazebo has hand worked iron, and there is an exquisite hand carved tree on the corner. A fun afternoon evening can be spent along malecon or on plaza, the heart of al the villages in Mexico is the plaza.

581263436.name: Beautiful area for singles and families
581263436.author: a TripAdvisor user
581263436.reviewBody: Nice little pier and wonderful walkway for a stroll. There are plenty of places to eat and drink around the area but the jewel is the Maleon.

580906872.name: stroll on the Malecon
580906872.author: a TripAdvisor user
580906872.reviewBody: Very pleasant walk along the lake, meet and talk with people, enjoy watching the kids play. Great to take a beverage of choice and enjoy the view.

579089723.name: A sunset stroll by the lake.
579089723.author: a TripAdvisor user
579089723.reviewBody: Great way to end the day. We live here so we get to go often. Depending on the day and time of the year, you never know what you might find on the Malecon. Vendors offering jewelry, roasted corn, potato chips with salsa, handmade jewelry or hats and maybe toys for the kids. Somedays it\'s busy with musicians, some practicing, others skilled plying for tips or just to share. Maybe an impromptu drumming circle to serenade the sunset. Families and children enjoying the day. A skate park to watch the skateboard and bike enthusiasts. Beautiful murals by local artists. Very nice place!

571291878.name: Feel fresh walk
571291878.author: a TripAdvisor user
571291878.reviewBody:
A good place to start the day on the Malecon in Ajijic.  Pleasant to walk along side Lake Chapala
with views of the mountain range and watch the sun come up or just join with other morning
walkers with and without dogs.  Hola to those passing by always gets a reply back.  As well as being scenic and refreshing, people are so friendly.  Depending on the time you walk, one may see
exhibits for sale being set up or even a movie being made.  Always an active spot while keeping
it's serenity while sitting on a bench to enjoy the views.

570285945.name: Great sunsets!
570285945.author: a TripAdvisor user
570285945.reviewBody: Very pleasant walking. Interesting bird life. Friendly people. Many interesting trees in blossom, including various palms and jacarandas in season.

566306289.name: Leisurely walk on a bright day
566306289.author: a TripAdvisor user
566306289.reviewBody: Clean and organised. Great attractions for all ages. \nPlenty of shops and sightseeing places.\nStop in for food and drink. It\'s all good and readily available.

564476683.name: High quality walk
564476683.author: a TripAdvisor user
564476683.reviewBody: Very nice brickwork and paving covering half mile.  Many activities, like craft vendors, boating, children\'s playground, exercise area, outdoor auditorium, basketball court, skateboarding area, dog par,

564064323.name: Pleasant walk by Lake
564064323.author: a TripAdvisor user
564064323.reviewBody: We enjoyed walking along the Lake mid-day. Saw white pelicans, herons, etc. Safe, clean and quiet. Restaurants are near by.

563063323.name: Not as impressive as Chapala
563063323.author: a TripAdvisor user
563063323.reviewBody: This Malecon needs to be spruced up, it looks rather shabby when compared to the Malecon at Chapala which is clean, has many restaurants, and a real beach

562603308.name: Beautiful views, family friendly, safe.
562603308.author: a TripAdvisor user
562603308.reviewBody: The Ajijic malec\u00f3n is a great place for a morning or evening walk. There\'s a gentle breeze off the lake and you can watch the sunrise or sunset at either end of the lake. Lots of walkers and on weekend evenings the place is alive with Mexican families celebrating time together with food, music, kites, sports and even birthday parties. There are washrooms (5p), a skate park, vendors who are not pushy and even exercise equipment. Don\'t forget all the great restaurants nearby! A lovely place to spend an hour or a few!

560894120.name: Worth visiting
560894120.author: a TripAdvisor user
560894120.reviewBody: I arrived on a Sunday and quickly realized this is when all the local families have picnics here- with the kids and dogs running around freely. It was pretty cool to witness, and no one was glued to their phone! I did visit it again on a weekday and it was completely quiet and relaxing. The view across the lake is amazing as well.

560849600.name: Nice walk along the lake
560849600.author: a TripAdvisor user
560849600.reviewBody: We spent one day in this town and enjoyed the Malecon. You can have a peaceful walk, and enjoy the beautiful lake.

557801914.name: Nice for a short stroll
557801914.author: a TripAdvisor user
557801914.reviewBody: The Malecon is a nice place to walk along Lake Chapela.  It is however not very long and you don\'t want to look at the lake too closely as it is very polluted.  When we were there the lake was covered in a green slime.  You feel sorry for the birds and fish life.  There are beautiful white pelicans and egrets all along the lake as you walk the Malecon.

556121838.name: Perfect setting for a stroll along Lake Chapala
556121838.author: a TripAdvisor user
556121838.reviewBody: Beautifully landscaped and maintained, the large boardwalk and adjacent park are never as busy as nearby Chapala\u2019s.  Rather than the large buildup of vendors at Chapala, there are a few vendors, none aggressive, playgrounds, a decent sized cement skate park, and plenty of mostly locals fishing, cooking, picnicking and socializing, just having lots of peaceful, family fun. Restaurants are up the Main Street from one end of the Malecon, as well as several along the waterfront at the same end.  The smaller number of foreigners (like myself) feel welcome to just enjoy this slower pace along the waterfront. I made the 3/4 mile or so stroll at least twice daily the couple of months I was there, and never tired of the waterside sights.  Sunsets here are incredible, and rarely crowded.

554506516.name: A beautiful, peaceful stroll
554506516.author: a TripAdvisor user
554506516.reviewBody: We loved walking along the malec\u00f3n. Beautiful egrets and pelicans, happy families, lively children, and vibrant art.  A \u201cmust do\u201d. We visited for a week, and walked it daily.

552333714.name: Beautiful, less crowded
552333714.author: a TripAdvisor user
552333714.reviewBody: We once again enjoyed walking the Ajijic malecon on a Sunday afternoon.  It was very beautiful and tranquil.  Way less busy than the Chapala malecon.

552111590.name: Wonderful park aon lake front walkway
552111590.author: a TripAdvisor user
552111590.reviewBody: Great way to see Lake Chapala, exercise, shop in the heart of Ajijic.Skate board park, exercise equipment. Food and gift vendors. Popular with locals. Easy walk to central plaza .

549514358.name: Nice visit and lunch
549514358.author: a TripAdvisor user
549514358.reviewBody: We were in Ajijic just for lunch and wondering around this small colorful town in the Chapala Lake in Jalisco. We had amazing fish tacos, great tequila off course and amazing view to the lake. Ajijic has a lot of foreing people, and by foreign i mean some couples that decided to retire o had the oporto to live and enjoy the mexican lifestyle in this amazing country and choose Ajijic because of its amazing weather all year long. There are plenty of small beautiful hotels and lots of B&B villas to have a good and relaxing experience of Jalisco and Chapala Lake. People are, as usual in Mexico, extremely friendly and willing to help you with everything you might need.

548942099.name: Wonderful lakefront Walk.
548942099.author: a TripAdvisor user
548942099.reviewBody: Lots of parking.  Leisurely stroll in an animal friendly walkway and park. Families love to picnic and enjoy time together.  Watching the birds and fishermen as you walk along or as you sit on benches which welcome you. Restaurants near the peer, exercise equipment, grassy areas even skateboard parks, there is something for everyone.

547575064.name: Nice Promenade along Lake Chapala
547575064.author: a TripAdvisor user
547575064.reviewBody: We walked along the malecon for a bit before dinner last week. It\'s not the best malekan I\'ve ever been to, but it\'s certainly adequate.  At least there were no Hawkers like on many of the other strolls we\'ve taken in Mexico!

544874506.name: Fantastic Bird Watching
544874506.author: a TripAdvisor user
544874506.reviewBody: A wide promenade built to overlook Lake Chapala.  Many people can stroll and have their own space.  Children can play, picnics too.  We were pleasatly surprised with the birdlife.  Of course, the pelicans steal the show. They are so graceful and big!  Vendors are about, no one is ever agrresive. Grab a bag of potoato snack and have the vendor salt and salza them.  It\u2019s what the natives munch on and they are yummy.  We are here for week and make this walk daily.  The sunsets are worth coming back at night.  Not sure about sunrises, we are on holiday time.  Dont forget when you are in Ajijic, tip well, even the person who bags your groceries.  They work very hard for very little and travellers have so much.

541821915.name: Beautiful
541821915.author: a TripAdvisor user
541821915.reviewBody: This is a great place to go for a walk any time of the day. The view is amazing. The surface is flat (important because most of the sidewalks are uneven so one must be careful). I enjoy spending time here sitting on the benches and watching the people. There are many areas to sit, fire pits to have BBQ\u2019s, places to work out, markets, etc.

539121685.name: Highlight of Ajijic
539121685.author: a TripAdvisor user
539121685.reviewBody: Great for a walk along the Lake, as there are few places in Ajijic where you can do this.  Best to go to see the sunset or early morning sunrise.  Probably want to avoid the weekends as they are filled with locals and Tapatios from Guadalajara.

537008258.name: Best place to walk in Ajijic
537008258.author: a TripAdvisor user
537008258.reviewBody: Beautiful stroll along the lake. One of the few places to walk without tripping on the cobblestones. If you start on the western end you will be rewarded with places to eat and drink when you get to the end. It was nice to see families out enjoying a nice Sunday on the lake. Along with walking or jogging, there is a low tech exercise area.

536715058.name: Stroll Along the Lakefront ANYTIME of Day
536715058.author: a TripAdvisor user
536715058.reviewBody: The Ajijic Malecon is, in many ways, the heart of the town. People of all ages walk, sit, play, dance and enjoy this "city park on the lake." The Lake (Mexico\'s largest freshwater lake) is beautiful and is benefiting from the recent protection is is getting to protect it\'s ecosystem. If you want a fun day, take a turn around the entire lake. It\'s a nice day if you stop along the way to tour and eat at the little villages.

536058071.name: Ajijic Malecon
536058071.author: a TripAdvisor user
536058071.reviewBody: Loved the walk along the lake from Colon street back to our Casito on Ocampo. Well kept, lots of trees, great areas for families and lots of sitting areas.

532177598.name: Sleep, Quaint Town
532177598.author: a TripAdvisor user
532177598.reviewBody: This is such a neat quiet town with great little shops and restaurants near the Malecon. Lake Chapala is much larger than you think and there many areas to explore. Many retirees from the states and Canada live here because of the slower pace and low living expenses. If you are visiting Guadalajara you will need to hire a driver for the day which cost us $100.00 for 7 hours.

531438113.name: A place of peace and beauty
531438113.author: a TripAdvisor user
531438113.reviewBody: i could speak two hours about my experiences on the Malecon of Ajijic, this is a park walk along a 50 mile lake, an ancient mysterious lake - unpolluted, serving many villages - a very healing lake, the walk is family friendly, pet friendly, there are restaurants and gift shops nearby, but most fun of all are Mexican families celebrating birthdays, pets playing, horses dancing... i love this place

531176166.name: beautiful for a walk or to view the sunset
531176166.author: a TripAdvisor user
531176166.reviewBody: This is a great place to take a walk, especially in the morning.  go in the evening and enjoy a spectacular sunset.  Plenty of benches to sit.  Nice skateboard park.  Plenty of nearby restaurants.

530228597.name: Pleasant Place to Stroll
530228597.author: a TripAdvisor user
530228597.reviewBody: We walked the malecon daily from our rental casita to the plaza and back. A great place to both bird watch and people watch. Too bad Lake Chapala is polluted or it would be a great place for water sports. Locals do fish and swim there however. There are many places along the way to sit and look across the lake at small villages

524482320.name: Pleasant stroll
524482320.author: a TripAdvisor user
524482320.reviewBody: Malecon is a "boardwalk" along the lake.  It\'s calming and pleasant to watch people and look out on the water.  You can run along or stroll whatever suits you.

522094696.name: Best view
522094696.author: a TripAdvisor user
522094696.reviewBody: I loved visiting the malecon, it is so lovely, calm and relaxing.\nJust for a walk or spending the day.\nRemember to wear sunblock if sunny ;)

517221035.name: Missing
517221035.author: a TripAdvisor user
517221035.reviewBody: Restaurants on the waterfront, like the rest of the world, France, Italy etc.  Not very cosmopolitan.  It would be nice to sit at a restaurant overlooking the lake.  Nice to have a choice of cuisines.  Even just a place to sit down and enjoy a drink and a snack along the Ajijic malecon.  But there is nothing.

513446182.name: Inviting and perfect for a comfortable stroll.
513446182.author: a TripAdvisor user
513446182.reviewBody: Beautiful. Clean. Good energy.  Enjoyed watching children playing in the playgrounds, dog walkers, family picnics, New babies, young lovers, happy seniors, and then there\'s a beautiful lake.

512415964.name: Beauty of Mexico
512415964.author: a TripAdvisor user
512415964.reviewBody: We visited friends in Ajijic last March. What a treasure of a place!!! Canadians and Americans living peacefully and respectfully in this wonderful Mexican community. The weather is almost always perfect. Not to cold, not too hot. Sometimes a little dry and a little wet. Mostly perfect! Nice restaurants. Good shopping. Artistic treasure of a place! Muchas gracias Mexico!

510329909.name: Love the walk
510329909.author: a TripAdvisor user
510329909.reviewBody: My wife and I love walking the Ajijic Malecon.  It is beautiful specially in the late afternoon with a slight breeze coming off the water.  The area is relatively quiet during this time (July) unlike the winter time when the whole area swells by adding more than 10,000 snowbirds.  That attests to the nice weather of this area which clearly attracts winter travelers.

507043365.name: Improvements every year
507043365.author: a TripAdvisor user
507043365.reviewBody:
I enjoy visiting this town every year .
It is so artistic.
I like the idea that dogs are only allowed on the leach 
Great food places. Outstanding Art Galeries .

506144676.name: Festive-Worth a Look
506144676.author: a TripAdvisor user
506144676.reviewBody: The Ajijic Malecon has been updated by the local government so it is clean and great for walking and viewing Lake Chapala.  There is parking if you drive to the Malecon and benches if you want to sit and relax as you view the lake.  The restaurants and shops line the Malecon and on Saturdays vendors are out in force selling their goods and there is live music in the streets leading to the Malecon.\n\nAjijic is a very colorful and artistic community.  I recommend a visit to the welcoming town!

502869531.name: Excellent for walking or running
502869531.author: a TripAdvisor user
502869531.reviewBody: The Malecon is a walking areas right along Lake Chapala. It is not far from some good restaurants, perfect for a nice walk after a meal. Many use this as an early morning running area. Very worth checking out.

493142113.name: Good walk spot
493142113.author: a TripAdvisor user
493142113.reviewBody: The Ajijic Malecon is a good length nicely bricked walkway right on Lake Chapala. You can power walk, or sit on one of the numerous benches and watch the birds on the beach. The skateboarders have their own area so you  are safe from being run over. Weekday mornings there are few people at this time of year so you might only see a dozen other folks during an hourlong trek. There are lots of trees and flowering shrubs and tables in the shade, even a few BBQs. There is a tribute to a local benefactor, Juanita and skiff there as a memorial. The Malecon is much busier on weekends and during the North American winter when lots of snowbirds are getting some exercise. And evening strolls are just as lovely as morning power walks, when you can watch the sky change colors as the sun goes down.

487675611.name: Ajijic malecon
487675611.author: a TripAdvisor user
487675611.reviewBody: Very peacefull and clean. Weekdays are bast as it is less crowded. Enjoy gentle breeze coming from the lake in the evening. Nice trees to sit under.

484114579.name: Peaceful and pleasant
484114579.author: a TripAdvisor user
484114579.reviewBody:
So we have lived here 5 months and believe it or not, this was the first time we made it here. 

So much nicer than what I thought it might be. But I'm not sure what I thought it would be. 

Clean, well lit, filled with couples and friends and family. Such a nice place just to enjoy the lake and our piece of paradise.

481437694.name: Anniversary
481437694.author: a TripAdvisor user
481437694.reviewBody: Word can\'t really describe this promenade, about a mile long back and forth. Great view of the lake. Meet many interesting people.

480700818.name: Stroll your troubles Away!
480700818.author: a TripAdvisor user
480700818.reviewBody: The Malecon in Ajijic is a tourist/visitors way of "Decompressing" your troubles away while strolling this walkway filled with locals, lovers and their furry friends.  This is a place to see and to be seen.  Enjoy "People watching", and check out that scenery from the Lakeside!  The sunsets here are like no other and especially during the rainy season!  Lake Chapala is the largest lake in Mexico and the Malecon hugs this body of water in a very romantic way.  Walkers, Joggers, and lovers adorn this walkway during the early morning, afternoon and evenings in this magical fishing village we call Ajijic.  Bring your bottle of beer, tequilla, or your "Vino Tinto" and sit at the picnic tables that face the lake and BBQ!  Bring your family, & your "Friendly" dog (Lesch it please) and enjoy the Ajijic Malecon!  5 stars!

479550539.name: A lovely stroll on the pier
479550539.author: a TripAdvisor user
479550539.reviewBody: A great view along Lake Chapala. Plenty of play equipment for kids.  A wonderful place for a picnic. Cafes for coffee or meals.

478515808.name: A great walk along the lake
478515808.author: a TripAdvisor user
478515808.reviewBody: This is a very nice malecon along the lake, about a 1/4 mile or so.  Depending on the day it can be quite busy or almost deserted.  Well worth a stroll at anytime

477817085.name: Beautiful view of the Mountains
477817085.author: a TripAdvisor user
477817085.reviewBody: Great to walk early in the morning. Always things going on in the evenings. Good for families, lovers or friends.

476225854.name: The Boadwalk in Ajijic
476225854.author: a TripAdvisor user
476225854.reviewBody: There are no boards. This ia about a mile stretch of raise concrete walkway along the shore of Lake Chapala.\nOn weekends families can be found with their picnic/party areas clearly defined and inviting. In this super friendly space pictures, food, family, fun, and people watching abounds

475108683.name: Beautiful and relaxing
475108683.author: a TripAdvisor user
475108683.reviewBody: Take a stroll in the evening or an early morning jog. Eat at one of the lake side restaurants or just sip a cappuccino. Ride horses, go kayaking or just sit and meditate. The malecon is a wonderful place to be with friends and family. Shops are within blocks and vendors are there in the evenings.

475083295.name: Job well done
475083295.author: a TripAdvisor user
475083295.reviewBody: The Malecon is beautiful addition along the lake. Wonderful place to walk or sit and meditate ,watch the lake ,the gorgeous sunsets or the warm friendly people. Highly recommend it if you are in the lakeside area

473153411.name: A lovely spot on the lake
473153411.author: a TripAdvisor user
473153411.reviewBody: We were here for our exploratory visit and had a beautiful walk by the lake with benches so we could just sit and enjoy it. We also saw a performance of Ballet Folklorico that was great in the little amphitheater. So now, April 2017, I am finishing this review not as a visitor but now a resident of this lovely town. Vive Mexico!\n

472252489.name: Amazing sunsets, good walking, sometimes very loud and noisy.
472252489.author: a TripAdvisor user
472252489.reviewBody: Other than the occasional blasting music from frequent parties (especially on weekends and some weeknights), this is a beautiful place to spend time. Can be very peaceful at times, as well as place with craft and food merchants. Great for kids of all ages, with swing sets, play equipment, skateboard and bike jumps, basketball courts and the lake.

469912181.name: Clean, safe park setting.
469912181.author: a TripAdvisor user
469912181.reviewBody: The Malecon in Ajijic is a pretty concrete boardwalk with great views of the lake. It is clean and safe even at night.

468996793.name: Family-Oriented and Scenic
468996793.author: a TripAdvisor user
468996793.reviewBody: A morning run, an evening stroll, or an outing with friends and family...No matter why you visit the Malecon in Ajijic, the weather and serenity are so inviting.

468392234.name: Great way to spend an afternoon.
468392234.author: a TripAdvisor user
468392234.reviewBody: So much fun to walk along the lake and people watch. This area is very clean and there are many nice play areas for children including a skateboard area. It\'s not overrun with vendors so it is easy to just enjoy the sights. The breeze coming off the lake was refreshing.

467285718.name: Lovely!
467285718.author: a TripAdvisor user
467285718.reviewBody: Great for a stroll, quiet during the week and busier on weekends with lots of families.Music, food and shops on weekends.

466366451.name: Beautiful views.
466366451.author: a TripAdvisor user
466366451.reviewBody: A clean park like area, lovely view of the Lake.  Nice place to people watch, enjoy a take away coffee.  They has a small musical event while we were there, very pleasant.

466036948.name: Pretty path by the lake
466036948.author: a TripAdvisor user
466036948.reviewBody: A nice paved walkway along Lake Chapala in Ajijic. It\'s not very long (1/2 kilometre). There is a clean public washroom, but bring your own toilet paper or have a few spare pesos to buy some from the man outside.

465671400.name: great place for walks and weekend entertainment
465671400.author: a TripAdvisor user
465671400.reviewBody: usually something going on over the weekend; this time it was live band and dancing horses... yes, really.  the kids enjoyed the playground, we all enjoyed a walk along the water, putting toes in the sand, getting treats from street vendors (there are restaurants just a few metres away, too).  and there is always ample parking, which we sometimes use to visit the central Ajijic shops and streets just a short walk away.

465278578.name: sunday malecon
465278578.author: a TripAdvisor user
465278578.reviewBody: A favorite place to spend a few hours on a Sunday as families gather, children play in the park and vendore ssell their wares

464618661.name: Beautiful Lake Views
464618661.author: a TripAdvisor user
464618661.reviewBody: This is a beautiful quiet place to sit and enjoy the breeze off of the lake during the week.  It gets more crowded on the weekend as many people from nearby Guadalajara come to Chapala/Ajijic for a day trip.

463778986.name: Morning walks on the boardwalk!
463778986.author: a TripAdvisor user
463778986.reviewBody: Love to stroll along and watch the wildlife and look at the lake. Favourite thing to do daily. Lots of people out saying hello and dog walkers. Nice breezes off the lake make it very comfortable.

462981617.name: Lovely place
462981617.author: a TripAdvisor user
462981617.reviewBody: Spent two weeks in Ajijic and spent some time on the Malecon.  Great spot with lovely views of the lake and mountains.  Lot of activity especially on the weekends with kids playing and families have picnics, etc.  The day we left, setup had begun for a festival with music, food, etc.  Wish we could have stayed for it.

462134346.name: Zumba on the Malecon
462134346.author: a TripAdvisor user
462134346.reviewBody: Every Monday, Wednesday and Friday mornings at 8:15 work out on the Malecon. Pay as you go, only 20 pesos.

460046455.name: Lake walk
460046455.author: a TripAdvisor user
460046455.reviewBody: Gorgeous walk right by the lake. On weekends curios vendors of all kinds. Beautiful for sunsets and sunrises!!\ud83c\udf05

459387579.name: A beautiful way to start your day
459387579.author: a TripAdvisor user
459387579.reviewBody: A very pleasant walk along Lake Chapala.  Great spot for families and for people watching. Our daily room our visit here.

459010473.name: Grateful
459010473.author: a TripAdvisor user
459010473.reviewBody: Beautiful Sunday morning stroll, met a very lovely Mexican women on the way, she turned around to thank us for continuing to support the local community in spite of our president.. so touching that she was compelled to tell us how many Mexicans feel towards U.S. citizens.

458186787.name: Lovely for a stroll.
458186787.author: a TripAdvisor user
458186787.reviewBody: Nice and picturesque place for a stroll. It is also the flattest place in Ajijic. A few shops and vendors during the week. Very crowded on the weekends.\n

457486832.name: A relaxing and peaceful stroll, take the time to sit and people watch
457486832.author: a TripAdvisor user
457486832.reviewBody:
Nice views and wide walking area.  Very safe during the day.  Not a lot of activity but quiet and lots of families.

The water level was low when we were there.

Nice stroll and we enjoyed the sculptures and art work.

457198208.name: Vacation
457198208.author: a TripAdvisor user
457198208.reviewBody: Very lovely . We take daily walks. Good for walking running, chatting with friends anx you can reach your daily Fitbit goal! Our daily routine after breakfast and we enjoy seeing all the pets and pet owners.

457177412.name: Nothing Special
457177412.author: a TripAdvisor user
