457177412.reviewBody: This is a small walkway and adjacent to the area are restaurants and stores.  The area adjacent to the Lake is filled with Mexican families enjoying the outdoors, eating  out, and playing with their children,.  We were there during the day  after New Year\'s and it was quiet and I felt safe. We had traveled from Guadalajara to do some of the  shops. I would not make a special trip from Guadalajara  to visit  this area  a brief stop by is all you need to see the view.  One reviewer recommended the area for the sunset and a drink.  We had a drink and were not there for sunset, however, I would not rate this area as worth  a special trip.

457020238.name: a slice of serenity
457020238.author: a TripAdvisor user
457020238.reviewBody: In the Malecon , you can find all the touristy things to do and some great restaurants, but the sunset on the Malecon (boardwalk) is just so relaxing, its worth the drive from Guadalajara

455623667.name: Sunset
455623667.author: a TripAdvisor user
455623667.reviewBody: A great spot to watch the sun set and enjoy an open air drink. Quiet,families and friends gather at all times. A good look at how the local people live in harmony. You can buy a snack or drink,watch the skateboarders or birds and ease into the evening.

455464248.name: Lovely walk along the lake.
455464248.author: a TripAdvisor user
455464248.reviewBody: This is area is filled with Mexican families enjoying themselves on the weekends. We felt very safe walking along the Malecon.

455189590.name: Awesome morning runs
455189590.author: a TripAdvisor user
455189590.reviewBody: While in Ajijic, my highlight was starting my day with morning runs along this lakefront pier! Many locals and visitors are seen along this walkway, all enjoying the breadth of fresh air and scenery.

454823636.name: Pretty & relaxing
454823636.author: a TripAdvisor user
454823636.reviewBody: Taking a walk down the Ajijic Malecon is a very relaxing time and pretty scenery. On weekends there are many more people on the Malecon.

454098300.name: Wonderful
454098300.author: a TripAdvisor user
454098300.reviewBody: This is the place to meander down the Malecon and enjoy the sights of the lake.  On the weekend family\'s enjoy the park and the lake and it is wonderful to see the children playing.  Great place to pass an hour or two just watching the water or the people, your choice.

453573903.name: Not to be missed.
453573903.author: a TripAdvisor user
453573903.reviewBody: We live in Ajijc and walk here regularly to see the beauty of the lake, the sunsetschildren playing.

453107125.name: Sunsets galore
453107125.author: a TripAdvisor user
453107125.reviewBody: Want to know where to go to view the sunsets of Ajijic? The malecon is where! The atmosphere with people milling about, food vendors sending out aromas that invite you to partake and restaurants close enough to imbibe with a margarita...or two!\nStroll all the way to the end and enjoy the sun as it begins its final good-bye for the day. Then return to the start not forgetting a backwards glance or two to catch the final shots of the glorious sunsets of the malecon

452824377.name: A great place for a level walk and people watching
452824377.author: a TripAdvisor user
452824377.reviewBody: This is a fabulous place to meet the locals, find your friends, enjoy families celebrating events.  Local vendors are always present for some food, local art and great picture taking.

452381781.name: Lakefront boardwalk
452381781.author: a TripAdvisor user
452381781.reviewBody: This is a leisurely walk to the malecon.  You are surrounded by Mexican natives, local ex-pats and tourists enjoying the peaceful atmosphere.  There are families, artists, lovers, and vendors out in the wonderful climate relaxing and just being happy.  I recommend this.

452151508.name: A pleasant surprise
452151508.author: a TripAdvisor user
452151508.reviewBody: We didn\'t expect it to be that nice. It had games for children, little market with interesting things on sale, the walkway was very clean and well maintained.

451323806.name: A Must
451323806.author: a TripAdvisor user
451323806.reviewBody: When one visits Ajijic, there are a handful of must-dos. Walking the Malecon and taking in the lake, the surroundings, the parks and the beached are one of them. At this time of year (ie, Winter), walk during the warm afternoon for a most enjoyable experience.

450863417.name: Great place to chill
450863417.author: a TripAdvisor user
450863417.reviewBody: Went there last summer, we drove from guadalajara and we although we had low expectations, we loved it! The place is nice for a walk have a few drinks and just sit and relax

450309505.name: Do It for the Exercise
450309505.author: a TripAdvisor user
450309505.reviewBody: There isn\'t anything healthier that a regular morning walk along the Ajijic Malecon. From one end to the other must be close to half a kilometer so both way and you done a full kilometer.  Plus you can also stop and work out on their exercise equipment conveniently located about 250 meters west from the pier.

449764288.name: Great Place to Watch the Sunrise or the Sunset
449764288.author: a TripAdvisor user
449764288.reviewBody: Wonderful way to start or end your day watching the sun come up or watching the sun go down. Walk end to end, about 10-15 minutes each way. It\'s paved so it is unlikely that you will trip. Wear a sweater or windbreaker as it can be nippy and much cooler than two blocks from the water.

449034187.name: Love this place!
449034187.author: a TripAdvisor user
449034187.reviewBody: The Malecon is a great place to walk, to exercise, to join in the lakeside zumba class or to just sit on a bench and enjoy the lake and mountain views while listening to Spanish music in the background. It is very clean and pleasing to look at with all the greenery. Enjoyed the little market there also.

448997114.name: Safe, flat, scenic
448997114.author: a TripAdvisor user
448997114.reviewBody: It may only be .9 miles down and back but it\'s a great place to go for a run/walk.  Went during the AM, caught the sunrise - lots of action, people walking, jogging.  During the PM, occasional music, skate park and futbol.  Cleaning looked about daily - different sections.

446484001.name: Always enjoyable
446484001.author: a TripAdvisor user
446484001.reviewBody:
Excellent morning stroll, lovely sunset, active and great people watching all the time!

On the weekends there are stalls selling different things, some very unique and clever items. 

Visitors and locals alike enjoy this space, for goodreason. Somedays you can see the fishermen out on their boats, somedays you can see people jogging. A well loved destination.

446085876.name: Nice walk along the lake
446085876.author: a TripAdvisor user
446085876.reviewBody: Nice flat area to walk along the lake and view white pelicans. A restaurant which we did not eat at is located at the beginning of the Malecon. Malecon is not very long but there are nice views of the lake. The Malecon in Chapala is much longer and is lined with vendors. Check them both out

445096941.name: Family delight
445096941.author: a TripAdvisor user
445096941.reviewBody: A wonderful area to spend a family day..Have a picnic, watch the entertainment, play on the playground equipment or work out on the exercise apparatus ...Then stroll along to a Lake side Restaurant for a drink & some lunch & sometimes music..\nWe have been lucky enough to be down at the Malecon when there was Dancing horses putting on a show..

444458385.name: Great place to walk, exercise or people watch.
444458385.author: a TripAdvisor user
444458385.reviewBody: The malecon in Ajijic is beautiful and clean.  It is a great place to walk or just watch other people walking by.

443282166.name: Lovely
443282166.author: a TripAdvisor user
443282166.reviewBody: If visiting Ajijic, walking the Malecon is a must. I live in Ajijic and cannot say what is my favorite time of day to go there. It is wonderful all the time. Love watching the people, the birds, the lake, the magnificent sunsets, dog walkers, etc. sundays are a special treat as Mexican families come out to relax. On the weekends there are a few vendors out, but not enough to be obnoxious. Our favorite is the little ice cream stand set up in the parking lot next to the pier. Owned by Angelica and her husband Carlos. We especially like their pistachio ice cream. They make all their own ice creams.

442036233.name: Beautiful boardwalk!
442036233.author: a TripAdvisor user
442036233.reviewBody: Lovely to stroll along especially at sunset! This is a beautiful clean boardwalk built along the shore of Lake Chapala. It is a lot easier to walk on than cobble stone streets tha\'s for sure!

440777104.name: Ajijic Malecon
440777104.author: a TripAdvisor user
440777104.reviewBody: An interesting but brief walk. Some interesting features but prefer to walk around the cobbled streets.

440589293.name: Early morning walk
440589293.author: a TripAdvisor user
440589293.reviewBody: Beautiful location, very clean and safe.    Peaceful for a walk with a great view of the lake.  Would highly recommend this for sightseeing and exercise. The area is very well maintained.

439014900.name: Lovely spot, great sunset, lake view, fun real Mexican vibe.
439014900.author: a TripAdvisor user
439014900.reviewBody: We\'re here for a week staying a block uphilll from the Melecon.  About four blocks along Lake Chapala.  Playground, skate park, bandshell, live music, families enjoying a Sunday evening.  Fabulous, friendly people and adorable babies.  Street vendors, dogs with sunglasses (really).  Great evening.

438873291.name: Great walk & view
438873291.author: a TripAdvisor user
438873291.reviewBody: A great place to walk, or sit and watch the view, sunset and all the people go by. \nThere is plenty of space to walk and even places to exercise. Very clean and well kept.

438272856.name: Beautiful walkway - pavement of ornamental concrete
438272856.author: a TripAdvisor user
438272856.reviewBody: Lakeside walk with tremendous view of Lake Chapala and easy access to lower city attractions. You will love the smoother surface after the stone streets in the town.

437662653.name: Lovely lakefront walk.
437662653.author: a TripAdvisor user
437662653.reviewBody: This is a perfectly lovely, clean lakefront walking area.  Beautiful lake views with benches all along.  Short walk, maybe 1/3 mile in length.  There were children and their parents happily milling about.  Really enjoyed walking the Malecon in Ajijic and felt totally safe.

437655258.name: Quiet stroll with a view of Lake Chapala
437655258.author: a TripAdvisor user
437655258.reviewBody: Early evening the mosquitoes can be a bit fierce but it is a nice quiet stroll in the evening to walk off supper.

437284416.name: Try a little promenade
437284416.author: a TripAdvisor user
437284416.reviewBody: The malecon has a dual personality; at morning it is a haven for the retired gringos/gringas to get their morning constitutionals with or without their pets, stop for a chat with friends or just power walk their way up and down the one mile circuit. A few others can be seen working up a sweat on the city government exercise machines located about half way along. Occasionally, a local fitness or Zumba class is held near the skate park. Come early evening and the weekends the park comes alive with the locals - note: these are the only times you will find the bathroom blocks open. Food vendors peddle their wares, local musicians strike up a tune, people party and drink and kids run around chasing soccer balls or riding bikes. Tourists are now a minority, but the occasional dog walker can still be seen. It is worth going at both times of the day to experience the change in ambiance of the place and pick your favorite time.

436989884.name: Spend a while
436989884.author: a TripAdvisor user
436989884.reviewBody: Wonderful place to walk morning and night.  Great to see all the locals enjoying friends, family, food and music.  Sit and listen as people gather to jam, watch a pick up game of football or enjoy the sun rise or the moon and stars over the lake.

435710637.name: Pleasant for an evening walk.
435710637.author: a TripAdvisor user
435710637.reviewBody: If you go to Ajijic or Chapala, it\'s a good idea to visit the Ajijic Malecon and take a walk. It\'s not something incredibly amazing but it\'s okay for a few hours. There\'s some nice things to buy. And sunsets can be nice on the lake.

435451180.name: Tranquility is feeling one experiences along this beautiful Lakeside path.
435451180.author: a TripAdvisor user
435451180.reviewBody: This family friendly path bordering Lake Chapala in Ajijic,Mexico provides an opportunity for family and "pero" to enjoy exercise in a peaceful surrounding. Utilize the many clever machines for toning the entire body while meeting new and old friends. Join a dance fitness group or just relax and enjoy a picnik. Join a pick-up basket ball game or watch your teen speed down the skateboard park.

432246815.name: Beautiful park, family friendly.
432246815.author: a TripAdvisor user
432246815.reviewBody: Beautiful walk along lake Chapala.  There is a park with washrooms, a skate park, kids playground, basketball courts & dog friendly area, with a mile or more of interlocking brick walkway.  There are restaurants nearby or benches to relax on.

431859638.name: Today was peaceful
431859638.author: a TripAdvisor user
431859638.reviewBody: Really enjoyed my walk along the Malecon. Not too many people but it was a weekday. There were a few families having picnics, and shore birds to photograph. The Malecon is beautifully done and walking was very easy compared to the cobblestone streets. Lots of places to sit and rest or just enjoy the view.

426407388.name: Great spot for a morning run
426407388.author: a TripAdvisor user
426407388.reviewBody: It\'s generally in good repair and smooth. In the evenings it can be very busy. I tend to go for a run early in the morning as it\'s not crowded and is a great spot to exercise. Several attractions along the length. The children park is in need of repairs.

423233960.name: Ajijic malecon
423233960.author: a TripAdvisor user
423233960.reviewBody: This is a great way to stroll along with your dog and chat with other people along the way. It is clean and beautiful. I live, so I can visit daily.

422542592.name: Lovely spot for a stroll
422542592.author: a TripAdvisor user
422542592.reviewBody: The malecon is the perfect spot for a walk along the lakefront with the locals, expats, tourists and their dogs.

421851046.name: Nice for a stroll
421851046.author: a TripAdvisor user
421851046.reviewBody: Scenic water front public park in lower Ajijic. Great place to relax in the shade of a tree and people watch. Very popular with the local population especially on holidays and weekends.

417730213.name: It depends on the day
417730213.author: a TripAdvisor user
417730213.reviewBody: This is a great walk but I will caution  you if you go on Sundays it can become packed with people  and merchant\'s selling everything from candy to tacos to ice cream I\'ve been both on a Sunday and a weekday it\'s very peaceful during the week but lacks the energy of Sundays when you can walk around among the Mexican families and dont worry about kids yes they will be there but they are usually very well behaved

417138844.name: Beautiful but over run
417138844.author: a TripAdvisor user
417138844.reviewBody: Ajijic. Is a beautiful small Mexican town located on lake chapala. I really enjoyed the beautiful squares and churches. On the down side it\'s a town over run by US AND CANADIAN seniors that act like their owed something for building ugly non traditional gassy houses on the mountain side. It\'s totally like parts of Florida you know GODS WAITING ROOM.  After talking to some locals you find they have been totally priced out of their communities. Sad because no gringos really care. \nDON\'T get me wrong it\'s a go see place and great for dental. Other than that no

416664253.name: It needs work!
416664253.author: a TripAdvisor user
416664253.reviewBody: Ajijic is a beautiful town, but I wish government would do more to clean the lake, to make the malecon better... It\'s been neglected and it\'s sad!

415699777.name: Beautiful place to stroll and relax
415699777.author: a TripAdvisor user
415699777.reviewBody: Ajijic has done a nice job creating access to Lake Chapala. Good place to watch people and the beautiful bird like along the lake.

413835927.name: Very nicely done
413835927.author: a TripAdvisor user
413835927.reviewBody: A really pleasant place to stroll. And the graffiti/art in the skateboard park is very interesting :).

411979677.name: quiet, clean and safe
411979677.author: a TripAdvisor user
411979677.reviewBody: The Ajijic malecon park is the pride of our village. We have been working on the plantings for years. Kids love the playground

411238445.name: Excellent!
411238445.author: a TripAdvisor user
411238445.reviewBody: My boyfriend and kids walked around the Malecon and evertything was quietly and the view is front the Chapala lake, no one mosquitos there \ud83d\ude31, we was really surprised about this,..... Very good place to families and kids \ud83d\udc68\u200d\ud83d\udc69\u200d\ud83d\udc67\u200d\ud83d\udc66

408801360.name: Ajijic Malecon
408801360.author: a TripAdvisor user
408801360.reviewBody:
I liked the "malecon" of Ajijic and Chapala.

But I prefer Chapala "malecon".

In Ajijic, you can see many interesting things, you can buy as a souvenir or anything for personal use.

Near Chapala, you can found one of the best top secrets: Water Skiing. This place is not the lake of Chapala. They use an artificial lake. The name of the place is BOCA LAGUNA.

407958617.name: An small and relaxing town!
407958617.author: a TripAdvisor user
407958617.reviewBody: Ajijic, Jalisco is a little, traditional and rustic town next to Chapala Lake and is 45 minutes away from Guadalajara, Jalisco city... this town is for the people who\'s looking for a relaxing time, where you can walk around this rustic place, buying traditional  souvenirs made by the town people, eat some Mexican traditional  dishes around of many Mexican restaurants and walking through the approximate 1 1/2 mile Malec\u00f3n and watch the sunset!!!..

404568214.name: Very nice stroll
404568214.author: a TripAdvisor user
404568214.reviewBody: A must do in Ajijic...fishermen, kids swimming, teens skate boarding in the skateboard park, kids playing, families gathering and cooking on the weekends..It is like Ajijic\'s back yard on the weekend.

404538427.name: Ajijic\'s Malecon beautiful  Evening walking under the stars
404538427.author: a TripAdvisor user
404538427.reviewBody: Romantic evening walking at the Ajijic\'s Malecon Chapala\'s Ribera. Beautiful colorful small Mexican town, great restaurants close to the lake with beatiful view at the lake, and coffee shops at the plaza, great place to getaway.

403898238.name: Lovely for a walk
403898238.author: a TripAdvisor user
403898238.reviewBody: Picturesque walk along Lake Chapala with benches to sit and enjoy the view. There is a skateboard park at one end for the younger folks, and the malecon is level, so easy walking for the senior folks. Enjoy!

402834845.name: A pleasant walk but there\'s nothing along it
402834845.author: a TripAdvisor user
402834845.reviewBody: I was GRANDPAcking in Ajijic for 1 week and popped down to the waterfront on several occasions.\nThe malecon is new, tidy and well kept ... and a pleasant walk.\nBUT, there are no cafes! It would be so much nicer if you had some open air cafes to relax in and while away some time.

400609324.name: Beautiful, but wish it were better.....
400609324.author: a TripAdvisor user
400609324.reviewBody: I love the Ajijic Malecon, but...I wish people would use the trash cans, not let their dogs run freely to soil the grass, etc., I wish the town would remove the glass, cans, bottles, plastic, etc. from along the lake shore, and I wish there was a police presence to monitor the graffiti and pot smokers who hang out around the skateboard park.  From Friday night to Sunday it gets crowded with weekenders who enjoy loud music, and beer.  Lake Chapala is an invaluable resource....I just wish people would take better care of it.

400133121.name: Very nice place for a walk
400133121.author: a TripAdvisor user
400133121.reviewBody: The malecon is not that big. I was hoping it was long enough for a good run, but it\'s not the case. Regardless, it\'s very nice, with gorgeous view of lake Chapala.

398204232.name: Nice & Clean
398204232.author: a TripAdvisor user
398204232.reviewBody: Great exercise to walk along the Malecon and see the black tipped white pelicans that winter here from Canada. Nice breeze with friendly natives seated along the lakefront.

395893733.name: A great place to start the day in Ajijic
395893733.author: a TripAdvisor user
395893733.reviewBody: We have lived in Ajijic for almost a year and start most days, after coffee of course, on the Malacon for a brisk or leisurely walk.  Even at 6:30 am we feel perfectly safe on this well-lit, level and paved "boardwalk" along the lake front.  Beautiful sun-rise and moon-set scenes are an added treat, There are a nice mix of regulars like us and short term visitors out by then, but not the family-friendly crowd we also enjoy during the day and evening.  We are in awe of the maintenance crew already at work keeping the grassy picnic, playground, parking, fitness areas spotless in spite of heavy use. The Malacon is in many ways Ajijic\'s living room with birthday parties, family reunions, baby showers and the like common on nice evenings and weekends. The Malacon is an Ajijic treasure!!

392926093.name: Beautiful!!
392926093.author: a TripAdvisor user
392926093.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place to visit. The scenery is fantastic. Families picnicing, children playing, great for walking. A wonderful place to spend the day.

391206521.name: Nice place to see the lake or get an evening breeze
391206521.author: a TripAdvisor user
391206521.reviewBody: This is a nice place to stroll, jog or cycle. Weekends they have local bands and music in the evenings in the park.

389835999.name: Great Place to Walk or Jog
389835999.author: a TripAdvisor user
389835999.reviewBody: Great spot for a leisurely stroll or a morning jog. There is even some basic fitness equipment in the adjoining park.

389609346.name: Ok to walk around
389609346.author: a TripAdvisor user
389609346.reviewBody: The malecon was pretty empty and not much going on. A little run-down. The shops and restaurants around the malecon (a couple of blocks into town) are nice. Strolling here it is nice, but nothing special in my opinion

389087039.name: Beautiful....but off leash dogs.
389087039.author: a TripAdvisor user
389087039.reviewBody: The malecon in Ajijic is beautiful. We brought our 7 lbs maltese with us and found ourselves having to pick him up quite often because of large dogs running loose (you never know...). So, just be aware of that should you too bring your fur baby with you.

388762531.name: Just Beautiful!
388762531.author: a TripAdvisor user
388762531.reviewBody: It was beautiful, CLEAN, peaceful and charming place to walk. All ages, lots of fur-babies and loads of smiles!

387858606.name: Great skate park for the kids.
387858606.author: a TripAdvisor user
387858606.reviewBody: the new councilman is try hard to make Ajijic a nicer, cleaner place, new slides and great little walk for the kids and visiting family, Has parking, bring your bike and skateboard

386770563.name: A nice place to walk in the afternoon.
386770563.author: a TripAdvisor user
386770563.reviewBody: The Malecon is a place for walking and enjoying the Lake But do this early in the morning or late afternoons since is hot during the rest of the day.\nThere are places to sit on the shade and make a picnic  A lot of restrooms around and there are a couple of restaurants to eat while watching the great lake

386606538.name: Refreashing
386606538.author: a TripAdvisor user
386606538.reviewBody: It is so nice to walk along the Malecon in the early morning with the sunrise.  Great place to enjoy a nice power walk saying "Buenos Dias" to everyone.

386238044.name: GREAT PEOPLE WATCHING PLACE
386238044.author: a TripAdvisor user
386238044.reviewBody: Very relaxing to enjoy a meal on the shore of Lake Chapala. Several of the restaurants also have live music

385077825.name: Not the Pacific but Lake Chapalla is so Large it Feels Like the Sea
385077825.author: a TripAdvisor user
385077825.reviewBody: Not the Pacific but Lake Chapalla is so large it feels like the sea and the Malecon in Ajijic is a must to stroll while taking in the beauty of the largest lake in Mexico. The Malacon is modern and in excellent condition. The area is safe. In fact the north side of the lake is the largest concentration of ex-pats (US, Canadian, Aussies, English, etc.) in Mexico so the area is affluent and well supplied in amenities. The Malacon has a few good restaurants and bars, but the Malacon and the adjacent beachfront is primarily nice property, several small resorts and a few local beach vendors. This gives the Malacon in Ajijic a very rural feel. With the main businesses at beginning 1 block in from the beach.

382921670.name: Fun Walk!
382921670.author: a TripAdvisor user
382921670.reviewBody: We walked along the Malecon each day we were in Ajijic.  Mainly for exercise.  On the weekend, the park is filled with artisans.  There are fun restaurants for a drink and a bite!

382579801.name: very relaxing
382579801.author: a TripAdvisor user
382579801.reviewBody: we stayed in Chapala and visited Ajijic.  they have a very nice board walk/stroll on the malecon, with great restaurants, have a beer, sit look right out over the lake.  their are bathrooms on the way so your covered.  it was very safe and clean.

379669934.name: Great place for a lakeside walk
379669934.author: a TripAdvisor user
379669934.reviewBody: Great lakeside walk, with a fun skate park. Mexican families have family birthday parties, Places to eat and drink nearby. Enjoy and lake and watching people.

377047148.name: Great people watching and restaurants
377047148.author: a TripAdvisor user
377047148.reviewBody: The malecon is frequented by families on the weekends, as well as tourists. Very colorful, kite flying, roller skating and just a glimpse of life in Ajijic. At one end of the malecon are the seafood restaurants, the biggest not being the best. We prefer Cozumel restaurant, but that is meat for another review!

376826654.name: Lakeside Boardwalk
376826654.author: a TripAdvisor user
376826654.reviewBody: This is not a commercial location, but the Malecon (Boardwalk) along the South shore of Lake Chapala.  There are a few restaurants along the way and a few benches to sit on. That\'s it

374598219.name: Golf carts
374598219.author: a TripAdvisor user
374598219.reviewBody: Was very excited to rent a golf cart here and in Chapala to explore only to find there were none available. Very disappointing

371866111.name: Learning my new neighborhood
371866111.author: a TripAdvisor user
371866111.reviewBody: As part of familiarizing myself with my new home, on the outskirts of the village of Ajijic, I\'ve explored various sections of the village. I always try to make sure that the malecon is part of that Adventure! Always a little different on each of those mini treks!

366410562.name: A Great Place To Watch The Sunset!
366410562.author: a TripAdvisor user
366410562.reviewBody: This place is a gathering place for the locals during the week and the visitors during the weekend. It is a great place to stroll at the end of the day. The place is also filled with people exercising along the malecon.

365811121.name: a tranquil end to the day !
365811121.author: a TripAdvisor user
365811121.reviewBody: Down here in Ajijic and have found the malecon to be a great way to wind down. Sun setting beyond the mountains with the foreground of this vast and peaceful lake. Families gather, friends play, children laugh and frolic happily, dogs walks as companions and quietly explore with each other...a very tranquil end to each day

365610995.name: Wonderful spot of stroll
365610995.author: a TripAdvisor user
365610995.reviewBody: What a great area to walk and greet people early in the morning or during the evening.  It would be great if you could walk all the way to Chapala.

363917919.name: One of many have to\'s in Ajijic and Chapala
363917919.author: a TripAdvisor user
363917919.reviewBody: Pleasant walk along the waterfront. Restaurants nearby. Evidently an important destination on weekends for  the local people. Especially Chapala. My impressions: the balloon man should be floating away like Up. So  many and many colors. Young people, hand in hand. Booths line the Chapala Malecon on weekends. Music. Playground. White Pelicans. Herons? Small fishing boats. Lake Chapala is so shallow they jump in the water to spread and pull in their nets and they appear to camp on the shore. Memorable sunsets. You need a walk. Go!

361886265.name: Very Pretty
361886265.author: a TripAdvisor user
361886265.reviewBody: The Malecon in Ajijic is very nice and clean. A great view of the lake. Walked from one end of the Malecon to the other taking pictures, very pretty A nice view of the Mexican culture. There was a nice Mexican restaurant on one end of the Malecon and it was very good. Great Chicken Noodle Soup.

361752744.name: Enjoyable place to walk and enjoy the view of the Lake
361752744.author: a TripAdvisor user
361752744.reviewBody: As a Snow Bird (Winter) VS a Sun Bird (Summer) resident, we enjoy our Sunday walks to the down town area, to the "Open Circle" talks, the square for lunch and then a walk on the Malecon.  It is enjoyed by all and very few vendors.

361214604.name: I love the Malecon in Ajijic. It is a great place to walk, see the lake and meet old and new friends.
361214604.author: a TripAdvisor user
361214604.reviewBody: Lots to do and see on the Malecon. Kids in the skateboard park, concerts in the amphitheater and Zumba classes. Just sit on a bench or at a table to picnic to pass a pleasant afternoon, morning or evening

360768009.name: A few blocks from my house and a nice place to relax!
360768009.author: a TripAdvisor user
360768009.reviewBody: You get a nice view of the lake with a breeze off the lake. Depending on the time of year you may see a celebration of food and music very often for free. Local vendors sell home made ice cream, bread, tamales and more. A family setting of Great People! About 85 % local Mexican and the rest North American retirees.

357459110.name: Pleasant walk along the shore
357459110.author: a TripAdvisor user
357459110.reviewBody: A clean, pleasant park area!  Great for a stroll, very few vendors, friendly locals and ex pats. Exercise, snack, take photos, beautiful location.  Ample parking except Sunday afternoons.

357150123.name: Cute little pueblo
357150123.author: a TripAdvisor user
357150123.reviewBody: My daughter and I went to ajijic with my son and my daughter in law and stayed in Casa de la Abuela it was divine we felt right at home the owners are wonderful people and they cook for us very good breakfast we went walking to the beautiful plaza and the malecon we enjoy every minute of our stay there I recommend Casa de mi Abuela is a very clean and beautiful place and you would fell right at home

356166500.name: Watch the children...........
356166500.author: a TripAdvisor user
356166500.reviewBody: Pleasant place to walk and on weekends, people watch.  Families gather with children & picnics, kids on skateboards in the dedicated area are amazing to watch.

355614725.name: Wonderful walking along the lakeshore
355614725.author: a TripAdvisor user
355614725.reviewBody: In the early morning the malecon is a popular spot for jogging and walking unencumbered by traffic or cobble stones.  For the remainder of the day it is the place for locals and visitors to wander as the enjoy the breeze from the lake taking their daily constitutional or walking their dogs. On weekends the area is packed with families enjoying picnics, birthday parties and barbecues.  For families there is an exercise circuit, a skateboard park and basketball hoops. On weekends there are also refreshment stands and local artisan vendors.

355583212.name: .best views -tranquil
355583212.author: a TripAdvisor user
355583212.reviewBody: dog walkers early mornings, later in the day family picnics. Zumba classes in the amphitheater 9 a.m, on site bar Bq\'s.Monitored restrooms

353377355.name: Nice place to spend an afternoon.
353377355.author: a TripAdvisor user
353377355.reviewBody: We spent and afternoon just walking and people watching. There are a lot of cafes and the square is only a short walk away. It was a warm day like always in Ajijic but a nice breeze from the lake.

352960076.name: Nice but small
352960076.author: a TripAdvisor user
352960076.reviewBody: Very small waterfront walking area, but it\'s beautiful. Simple, serene, but short. Nice views of the lake and water halcianth.

352895081.name: BEAUTIFUL
352895081.author: a TripAdvisor user
352895081.reviewBody: Great people watching and always clean and manicured. The lake and the swans are lovely. Crowded on weekends as locals picnic and play with their families.

352240969.name: Top attraction
352240969.author: a TripAdvisor user
352240969.reviewBody: A lovely walkway along the lake and a great place to get that morning exercise or to watch the sunset.  Lots of famiies picnic and party here on weekends.

352185890.name: Lovely waterfront walk
352185890.author: a TripAdvisor user
352185890.reviewBody: I spent a lot of time in Ajijic in 2015 as my father was ill. This was a place we would walk and sit and watch the water birds and people on horseback and skateboarders. Quite lively most of the time!

351453807.name: Nice wander, good view of the lake.
351453807.author: a TripAdvisor user
351453807.reviewBody: I took a wander around here. Seemed to be visited by a lot of people.  Please and peaceful.  Worth a day trip out to see and explore the town at the same time.

349814998.name: Tranquility and Action
349814998.author: a TripAdvisor user
349814998.reviewBody: This is a great place to take morning or evening walk and many festivals and parties are held here.  You may want to avoid it on weekend evenings.

349192794.name: Clean,nicely designed walkway along the Lake Chapala shoreline.
349192794.author: a TripAdvisor user
349192794.reviewBody: Trees and benches along this walkway - designed to look like a wave rolling along the shoreline - affords a splendid view around and across the lake. Heading east from the pier at the foot of Colon, you\'ll pass beautiful villas fronted by vibrant flowers on a well-maintained walkway. A few feet below the Malecon, families picnic on the grass under shady trees, brightly coloured small birds dart about, while graceful pelicans, white herons, egrets and sea gulls swim or stand peacefully in the calm waters.

348880073.name: Ajijic Malecon Through the Week
348880073.author: a TripAdvisor user
348880073.reviewBody: The Ajijic Malecon is a great place to spend some relaxing time watching the pelican\'s and other water birds.  The weekends are flooded with people from Guadalajara so I mainly go through the week when it is just the locals.  There are several restaurants near the melacon including one of my favorites Cocinart.  The moutains seen accross the waters of the lake are  a special view at sunset.  Usually there is smoke on the mountains as a farmer burns his corn field preparing it for the next crop.

348476701.name: Great morning walk to town.
348476701.author: a TripAdvisor user
348476701.reviewBody: We used the Malecon to walk to town rather than the streets. The sidewalks & cobblestone streets to town are a tough walk.

348185940.name: Nice place for a stroll.
348185940.author: a TripAdvisor user
348185940.reviewBody: Nice flat area to walk by the lake, which in Ajijic is a rareity. Plenty of benches and spots where you could have a picnic. There is a skate park and basketball courts on  the west end. There is no fence on the water side of the court so if you have a bad shot or pass your ball may end up in the lake.

347958541.name: Peaceful, beautiful, clean
347958541.author: a TripAdvisor user
347958541.reviewBody: A surprise to find such a nicely developed walkway along a Lake Chapala.  Quiet most days.  Weekends it has many local families, lovers, and vendors living life.  :)

346985651.name: Beautiful, Relaxing...Go at Sunset!
346985651.author: a TripAdvisor user
346985651.reviewBody: The sunset walk along the Malecon in Ajijic, Jalisco Mexico borders Lake Chapala for a nice relaxing time to reflect on the day and also watch kids playing, families spending time with one another.  Just beautiful!  Benches to sit on when you need a rest, too!  Afterward there are lots of great little cafes to stop in for a meal or a drink.  You will fall in love with the area and come back again and again, I know!

345822232.name: Nice but very very quiet
345822232.author: a TripAdvisor user
345822232.reviewBody: Not much going on in Ajijic Malecon except I suppose on national holidays. Nice and clean though and the people of Ajijic are very welcoming.

345567928.name: A must when visiting Ajijic
345567928.author: a TripAdvisor user
345567928.reviewBody: There is an excellent  workout area near the skate board site. A new computer center was added this year near the pier. The malecon is a lovely place to unwind and meet people.

344531408.name: A Highlight of Ajijic
344531408.author: a TripAdvisor user
344531408.reviewBody: A walk along Ajijic\'s malecon is not to be missed. Along with the zocalo (the main plaza) this is where you\'ll find the residents enjoying the town, gossiping, and playing. The views across Lago Chapala are outstanding, no matter the time of day, with that in mind, be sure to take it in more than once.

344129861.name: Picturesque view.
344129861.author: a TripAdvisor user
344129861.reviewBody: A lovely little stroll, with a park for the kids, a skate park for the teens and beautiful sunsets for adults of every age.  A great place for a walk anytime day or evening.  Most popular on holidays and weekends.  They have added some new statues since my last review and the lake is much healthier with green growth and abundant fish and bird life.

343435172.name: Great gathering place, day or evening
343435172.author: a TripAdvisor user
343435172.reviewBody: The malecon is a family place with kids on bicycles and skateboards, family picnics, dog walkers and bench sitters just enjoying the sunset.

342687829.name: Peaceful Easy Feeling
342687829.author: a TripAdvisor user
342687829.reviewBody: If you want to have a peaceful, easy feeling, just stroll along the Malecon. The sights are beautiful and you are sure to run into several friendly people.

342423032.name: Great place for an Afternoon Stroll
342423032.author: a TripAdvisor user
342423032.reviewBody:
Beautiful Sunsets over Lake Chapala, gathering place for the locals and tourists alike. 

Families, loud music, street vendors with coffee and candy, picnic tables and benches  in park area and on the boardwalk, roving mariachi band, some brave souls swimming in plant-covered water and some in boats navigating the through them, art in the park- Juanita's garden boat, Buddha, and more, a skatepark with some young talented female skaters and bike riders, soccer and basketball pick up games...

Some groups in cars parked on the shore beyond the Boardwalk-closer to the lake -more music, drinking and romantic activity. 

A great place to people watch while enjoying the sunset and getting your 10,000 steps in for the day

341455708.name: Community gathering spot
341455708.author: a TripAdvisor user
341455708.reviewBody:
The Ajijic Malecon is shorter than I'd like, but it's kept clean and there are always lots of people walking and chatting along the lake. There's an exercise station with a few pieces of equipment, a skateboard section, a basketball court, a couple of palapas, picnic area and benches to sit and enjoy the view of Lake Chapala. 

There are a few unattended dogs running around, but they're harmless. There occasionally is an intoxicated person sleeping it off on a bench, but that's very rare.

The Malecon is a good place to walk, talk, sit, watch the sunset and generally enjoy the atmosphere of Ajijic.

340573403.name: Beautiful setting
340573403.author: a TripAdvisor user
340573403.reviewBody: The malec\u00f3n  is a beautiful walkway along Lake Chapala in Ajijic. Many can be seen walking its length for exercise and for walking their dogs. The grassy area has picnic tables, activities for children, an outdoor gym , a skatepark and a basketball court and mini stadium for concerts. On the weekends the malecon is very active with local vendors, families  picnicking and tourists. Along the length of the malecon are benches to sit and watch water life: egrets, pelicans, ducks and the occasional fisherman or enjoy the peaceful setting.

340097296.name: Nice walk along the lake but nothing special.
340097296.author: a TripAdvisor user
340097296.reviewBody: Families gather in the park adjacent to the Malecon and provide a lively atmosphere--especially on weekends.

338759764.name: Beautiful place for a walk or photography
338759764.author: a TripAdvisor user
338759764.reviewBody: The malecon in Ajijic is one of the gems of this charming town. There is always lots of activity, whether it be joggers, dancers, lovers, or kids playing. Very mellow place with great sunset and wildlife views too.

337401212.name: Great place for a family picnic
337401212.author: a TripAdvisor user
337401212.reviewBody: First, despite what google images may tell you, there is no beach.  That said, the Malecon is a wide lake side walk with a strip park along it including play areas and picnic areas.  Some vendors set up here on the weekends, but it isn\'t crazy like many more touristy places in Mexico.

337091375.name: Enjoyable for a stroll
337091375.author: a TripAdvisor user
337091375.reviewBody: Pleasant uncrowded malecon, very local scene, lots of dog walkers, families, kids on skateboards, a few vendors who are always respectful. Nice views and sometimes great sunsets. Nice any time of day.

336788608.name: Wonderful walking experience
336788608.author: a TripAdvisor user
336788608.reviewBody: Clean, family friendly, non-commercial, palm tree-lined broadwalk on lakeside with parkland in residential area. Lots of activities to stimulate your senses as you walk the length of the malacon: horse-back riding; family picnickers with children frolicking in the beach or park; the occasional school bands practicing in the park; egrets and a myriad of exotic birds flying about or waiting in the water scanning for their next meal. A colourful and safe place to walk all day and into the evening.

335424311.name: Nice place to walk with the family and have a picnic
335424311.author: a TripAdvisor user
335424311.reviewBody: Very nice place to walk with the family and have a relaxing Sunday afternoon. We went for a walk and the view was beautiful of the lake. They have a nice skateboard park.

333800241.name: Beautiful afternoon!
333800241.author: a TripAdvisor user
333800241.reviewBody: What a lovely place to walk, sit, exercise, share food and anything else you might care to do to relax! We were there on a very beautiful day for our first visit and have since been back during the evening which was also nice. Great places to sit and watch the birds (and people) along the way.

333124956.name: Worth a look and see
333124956.author: a TripAdvisor user
333124956.reviewBody: The best part is all the interesting events that happen here. The walk down too the Malecon is very interesting with cool art stores. We were there when a race was going on so there was lots of people watching and stalls with all kinds of stuff for sale.

333117565.name: The best place to take in the sunrise, sunset, and people watch
333117565.author: a TripAdvisor user
333117565.reviewBody: whenever im on the Malecon (boardwalk) I instantly become happy. Such a lovely place to sit and be quiet, or go during the popular times and socialize. They offer Zumba, skateboarding, bike riding, dog walking, jungle jims, slides, places to grill and have a picknick, and just at the beginning of the walk are restaurants to grab a beer or michalada for your walk. there are the usual venders for snacks, and the odd bit of music.

332459092.name: Along the lake, not the sea.  Very nice for a run or walk.
332459092.author: a TripAdvisor user
332459092.reviewBody: Most resorts in Mexico are on the ocean and the city usually has a boardwalk or "Malecon".  In this case it along the lake shore.  It is very nice.

332197840.name: Nice place to walk the dog or go on a cheap date.
332197840.author: a TripAdvisor user
332197840.reviewBody: I walk my dogs here a lot. It\'s really pretty and there are always things to look at--good if you\'re on a date and your date is boring. There\'s only one restaurant--right at the beginning of the malecon--and it\'s not great, so don\'t go hungry. Also, beware of walking the dog at dusk--the ticks come out like crazy,

331451276.name: calming
331451276.author: a TripAdvisor user
331451276.reviewBody:
Nice place to walk and let the world go by..
A great place to think about nothing..
Just sit and relax...

330246800.name: Community
330246800.author: a TripAdvisor user
330246800.reviewBody: This a great place to spend an evening after a great meal. A lot of local folk out for walks and runs. Local bands practicing can be heard. I heard some guy playing his sax on the lakeside. very enjoyable

327692518.name: Very popular place to walk-many with whole family
327692518.author: a TripAdvisor user
327692518.reviewBody: Stroll along the Malecon, sometimes the market stalls open, music strollers, kids on bikes and lovely view of lake, although water is low and there is little boating activity

327675782.name: A walk in tranquility
327675782.author: a TripAdvisor user
327675782.reviewBody: This delightful walk by Lake Chapala provides an insight to life in a Mexican fishing village. flanked by Restaurants, Market Stalls, Boat tour operators it is spectacular.

327630193.name: A stroll in Paradise
327630193.author: a TripAdvisor user
327630193.reviewBody: What better place to stroll by a beautiful lake than in Lake Chapala, the second best climate in the world according to National Geographic.

326756051.name: Nice place to walk
326756051.author: a TripAdvisor user
326756051.reviewBody: The only level safe place to walk in Ajijic without the worry of tripping on cobble stones or holes and terrible sidewalks. Hopefully they will keep it free from litter. At the beginning of the malecon there is a stagnat smell from the lirio which they should get rid of. It is a very pretty view of the lake and mountains hopefully, they will look after this nice walking area.

326062143.name: Ajijic Malacon
326062143.author: a TripAdvisor user
326062143.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful Malacons in the world. Very clean and well kept with vendors on the weekends selling delicious foods, nuts, ice cream, etc.

325339012.name: Great place to walk
325339012.author: a TripAdvisor user
325339012.reviewBody: Wonderful place to walk and relax. You can even get a zumba class in the early morning. The coffee at the end makes a good espresso too.

325130973.name: Nice lakeside walk
325130973.author: a TripAdvisor user
325130973.reviewBody: Ajijic is a town with narrow streets, most of them cobblestone. In some areas there are narrow sidewalks but they are not always level or complete. The malecon offers a large stable, walking surface along the lake, especially if you like to walk at a good pace for exercise purposes. The unfortunate part is that the lake front is not that pretty - lots of weeds and some garbage. In some places, there is a foul smell. Even with all that, it is still a good place to walk.

323902037.name: Wonderful
323902037.author: a TripAdvisor user
323902037.reviewBody: My wife and I were visiting ajijic in late October to early November and spent quite a bit of time at the malecon. The view is spectacular of the lake and mountains. Wonderful restaurant\'s and shop. Would highly recommend checking it out

320529563.name: Lovely
320529563.author: a TripAdvisor user
320529563.reviewBody: The Malecon is a paved walkway along the lake.  Very pretty and lots of birds.  At times there are too many stray dogs but I really enjoyed walking here.

320527884.name: Walk with me, Talk with me...
320527884.author: a TripAdvisor user
320527884.reviewBody: I was fortunate enough to take a few walks on the Malecon... Once near empty on a afternoon.. the next in the flurry of laughing people, families, friends, enjoying a outing on a Saturday aftn.. Each its own charm.. A true gem for the community and visitors

318759501.name: Restful activity
318759501.author: a TripAdvisor user
318759501.reviewBody: First thing in the morning, or at the end of a good day, a walk along the Malecon never disappoints.  Greeting neighbors, watching shore birds, listening to music or watching families at play, every visit is different.   The view of mountains across the lake changes with the seasons and the weather.

318385620.name: Gorgeous
318385620.author: a TripAdvisor user
318385620.reviewBody: spent 2 weeks at Ajijic last year and find it so attractive that we have decided to spend 3 months there this year.  This place has a great climate...not too hot and not too cold. The Mexican people are so friendly and the malecon is a great walk anytime, especially weekends when all the families come out for some fun.

317206215.name: Enjoying the lake side.
317206215.author: a TripAdvisor user
317206215.reviewBody: This is one of our favorite things to enjoy in the late afternoon while in Ajijic on weekdays.  My husband and I start our walk together and by the middle of its length I sit in one of the benches to enjoy the vistas of the lake and the cute little ducks that are busily finding their daily sustenance.  It is a pleasure to watch sometimes a flock of herons gliding through the peaceful sky.  Meanwhile my husband energetically walks to the end of the malec\u00f3n and back to burn some of the calories from our daily succulent diners.  \nOn Sundays at midday, the town folk arrive early with their picnic provisions for a mexican barbecue or tasty home-made taquitos. Of course people bring whatever device they have to play their favorite music.  On weekends the malecon is always busy with vendors and people enjoying themselves. Children do play in the water and sometime grown ups enjoy a guided tour horseback riding. It\'s loads of fun to watch the kids play and enjoy their family time.

315644880.name: Gorgeous place
315644880.author: a TripAdvisor user
315644880.reviewBody: The view of the lake and the mountains is just incredible.  This in addition to one of the best climates in the world makes Ajijic a wonderful oasis.  It is a great place to relax and has many wonderful restaurants close by.

314318004.name: Fun any night of the week
314318004.author: a TripAdvisor user
314318004.reviewBody: We\'ve been staying in Ajijjic for 3 months and always enjoy a stroll along the malecon. Saturday night gets the biggest crowds and makes for good people watching. But on other nights it is also a great place to gaze at Lake Chapala and the birds who hang out along the shore. There are many benches for sitting and the smooth surface is easier on the knees than walking along the cobblestone streets.

313915128.name: Nice walk but disappointing waterfront
313915128.author: a TripAdvisor user
313915128.reviewBody: There is no beach waterfront, the tide wasn\'t all the way to the male on and it was weedy with some trash and rocks etc. It is a nice walk but quite short and no restaurant or bar to stop at currently. I do like all the benches Nd the outdoor gym equipment. Quite novel.

312368115.name: Sort of beat up looking
312368115.author: a TripAdvisor user
312368115.reviewBody: Not really eventful or pretty or anything really. Just a wall that you walk on next to a lake with weeds up to the wall. Not like other pretty malecon\'s....say in Havana or Montevideo etc.  But..it\'s the only water walk available.

309898389.name: Great place to spend the afternoon
309898389.author: a TripAdvisor user
309898389.reviewBody: We walked the malecon each afternoon, the lake level was really low but, that did not hinder the beauty at all. Great place to sit under the shade of a large tree and enjoy a book, buy some elotes or anything else for that matter.

309644788.name: Nice walk on the lake
309644788.author: a TripAdvisor user
309644788.reviewBody: A visit to Ajijic isn\'t complete without a stroll on the Malecon.\n\nThe lake seems distant in most places around Ajijic, but the Malecon is the place to enjoy the view and expanse of the lake. On a Sunday afternoon, families were picnicking and children were playing. It\'s a delightful place.

307628490.name: Love the Malecon!
307628490.author: a TripAdvisor user
307628490.reviewBody: What a great walk-way along the Malecon and the water. The have really done this up very well with activities for the kids, and outdoor gym, Zumba at night, right off-shore fishing, etc.

307560958.name: romance along the lakefront
307560958.author: a TripAdvisor user
307560958.reviewBody: The Malecon along the water was beautiful.  good for walking off a scrumptious meal.  We recommend it.

306731003.name: Great place for a stroll, run, or just to sit and enjoy the lake.
306731003.author: a TripAdvisor user
306731003.reviewBody: Great place to go running as it is one of the only places you won\'t turn your ankle!  There are also exercise facilities and plenty of places to sit and look at the lake.

305529211.name: Great for people and nature watching.
305529211.author: a TripAdvisor user
305529211.reviewBody: I took a walk with friends on Sunday and loved watching the families enjoying themselves. Many were having birthday picnics. Others were sitting on benches watching the activities on the beach and in the water. The swimmers seemed to be having such a good time. Great snacks for sale every few feet but not interfering with our walk. My favorite is the ice cream from Jocotepec.

305304463.name: Enjoy the breeze
305304463.author: a TripAdvisor user
305304463.reviewBody: The new malecon is the perfect place to stroll and be seen! With a pleasing park and refreshing lake breezes it is perfect for a stroll.

303080914.name: Beautiful park
303080914.author: a TripAdvisor user
303080914.reviewBody: Beautiful lakefront park.  View wonderful sunrise and sunsets.  Very beautiful for taking pictures and to just sit and relaz.

302229135.name: after dinner walk
302229135.author: a TripAdvisor user
302229135.reviewBody: after a lovely dinner at a seaside restaurant we took a leisurly stroll with the locals and met some nice people

301650413.name: Nice scenery.
301650413.author: a TripAdvisor user
301650413.reviewBody: Not a whole lot here besides the lake... the scenery is nice & there are numerous places visit, dine, etc. in Ajijic, just a couple of blocks away.

299307974.name: Good for a pleasant walk alongside the lake
299307974.author: a TripAdvisor user
299307974.reviewBody: A well used public space for everyone to enjoy.  Pleasant any time of the day because there is usually a breeze from the lake.

295834581.name: Sunset, Ice Cream Cone, Time to Get reconnected with Your Partner!
295834581.author: a TripAdvisor user
295834581.reviewBody: It\'s safe.  Take a stroll and enjoy yourselves.  Plenty of Park benches.  Try not to dribble Ice Cream all over yourself!

292436311.name: A look into the past
292436311.author: a TripAdvisor user
292436311.reviewBody: Family life is key in Mexico and it can be seen on the malecon..Families playing and picnicking together much like the 1950s in the US.

291047578.name: I loved walking the malecon; it is lovely
291047578.author: a TripAdvisor user
291047578.reviewBody: I liked the serenity and people watching as well as the beautiful lake.  It is inspiring.  There are vendors and a restaurant with good margaritas near by.  What more could I need.

290085374.name: Lake and mountains...perfect setting
290085374.author: a TripAdvisor user
290085374.reviewBody: Wonderful walk along Lake Chapala with mountains\n Well used by both viditors and locals classes and other activities, along with lovely gardes and birds along the shore. \n

289540943.name: views
289540943.author: a TripAdvisor user
289540943.reviewBody: Beautiful lake and mountain views and great people watching.  A must see on any trip to Ajijic. Relaxing stroll or vigorous walk anytime.  Wonderful.

287685886.name: A Nice place to take a stroll
287685886.author: a TripAdvisor user
287685886.reviewBody: The walkway is a very nice community area for a stroll, however there is an issue with the lake level.  The water level had receded so much that it does not feel very appealing.  We were told that measures are being taken to help restore the lake, but until that is done this leaves a lot to be desired.

286807177.name: wish it were longer
286807177.author: a TripAdvisor user
286807177.reviewBody: first off ajijic and chapella are expat heaven, it\'s like being in the states or Canada but your really in mexico, places are geared for tourists with prices that are reasonable but not dirt cheap !! that said one of the main draws is lake chapella and the walkway or malecon that you can walk around the area, it\'s absolutely wonderful clean safe, peaceful, with great views, I just wish they would extend it and make it longer, it\'s a good half hour walk, like to see an hour at least, but enjoy it anyway, I did..

286461080.name: Wonderful place to people watch!
286461080.author: a TripAdvisor user
286461080.reviewBody: Enjoyed walking along the lake, checking out the skate park and outdoor gym! Nice place for a picnic or an ice cream.

286143403.name: Walk for the Health of It
286143403.author: a TripAdvisor user
286143403.reviewBody: Ready for a pleasant walk. This boardwalk was recently built when the lake level was rather high. Individuals and families may enjoy the walkway. The Malecon has play areas and BBQ\'s, as well as public restrooms.

285182943.name: Fabulous for a stroll along the Lake\u2026.no cobblestones to deal with!
285182943.author: a TripAdvisor user
285182943.reviewBody: We love the lakefront access that is a smooth walk into town.  We walk from 6 corners to the lakefront almost everyday.  It\'s a great walk into the heart of the Ajijic village.  We often stop to sit and watch the birds and the local burros.  So lovely, and so Mexican\u2026just a beautiful way to walk into town without dealing with broken sidewalks and cobblestones.  Our only wish is that there will someday be more local art and venues along the Malecon.

285074990.name: It\'s a wonderful Walk
285074990.author: a TripAdvisor user
285074990.reviewBody: The Malecon in AJijic is a mini boardwalk on the lake. A wide sidewalk for strolling with scattered seating along the way. It\'s bordered by a grass area, picnic tables, children\'s play areas and even a skateboard ramp area. Quiet in the morning with dog walkers and joggers it becomes more\npopulated in the afternoons, weekends and holidays. It\'s full of  serendipity.....you never know what\nwill be happening  on the malecon....musicians,  dancers, birthday parties, mimes. It\'s always a pleasant surprise or just a peaceful stroll. Enjoy it!

284021044.name: Charming, beautifully done malacon with picnic tables, children\u00b4s entertainment -a lovely place to take a walk.
284021044.author: a TripAdvisor user
284021044.reviewBody: Smooth side walks, looks like a good family outting.  Skate board park, swings and other things for smaller children.  Well maintained.\n

283004400.name: A Malecon is Basically a Boardwalk - This Along Lake Chapala
283004400.author: a TripAdvisor user
283004400.reviewBody: The Malecon along Lake Chapala is relatively new and a great addition to this charming Mexican town.  It is long and broad, no feeling crowded.  At various points there are places to stop, such as school-yard style playgrounds and gardens.  There is also a skate park with features for "grinders."  There may be street vendors and even musicians on holidays.  One of the coolest things we saw on the Ajijic school-yard style playground was a fascinating display of figures celebrating Dia de la Muerta - the Day of the Dead.  This is a big deal in Mexico.  The figures may seem disturbing to NorteAmericanos because they are typically skeletons.  It is actually a way to revere the ancestors of the locals.  When we were there, the figures had an added aspect in that they were made to represent recycling.  \n\nIt is a very nice place for a morning or evening stroll.

281571895.name: I still cannot find the romantic ambiance people talk about.
281571895.author: a TripAdvisor user
281571895.reviewBody:
Ajijic and lake chapala could be something nice for people to enjoy, however its lacking the final element. Nothing would be more romantic than walking down the Ajijic malecon, sitting on a park bench and watching the sunset go down. This is the romantic side of a lake front cobblestone town.

What is missing, is the element of cleaning up the place so expats, foreigners and locals can truly enjoy the place. As soon as you come up to the malecon in Ajijic, well you are greeted with garbage thrown everywhere. You are also greeted with local vendors and people peddling the things they sell at full volume. And not to mention local business who think noise will attract business, so they blast their music at full volume.

All of these things ruin what would be a wonderful place in Mexico. Ajijic is a town mainly of foreign expats who live in Mexico. I am sure most of these people also desire the quietness they once used to enjoy in this area before local Mexican merchants started changing what was a peaceful place. There is much to fall in love with Ajijic, a colonial settlement with cobblestone streets which is close to the second largest city in Mexico, Guadalajara. But then you have the locals peddling anything for a buck.

When you are visiting places in Mexico, remember they charge for everything. Even to use a dirty bathroom, there will be someone charging money to go into the bathroom. The restrooms are located on the park side of the malecon. It feels strange, but that is how they operate in Mexico, as this is seen throughout the country, at gas stations, parks, malls, rest stops, bus stations, etc.

281216662.name: Nice and peaceful Lakefront
281216662.author: a TripAdvisor user
281216662.reviewBody: It is a nice , quiet place to relax, and spend time either by yurself or in company. The place is very well kept, clean, open space to picknic, read, or excerise.

280751900.name: Don\'t miss the Malecon while in, or near Ajijic!
280751900.author: a TripAdvisor user
280751900.reviewBody: The Ajijic Malecon is lovely for strolling or enjoying the beautiful views across Lake Chapala.  You simply must eat, or have a cool drink, under one of the huge eucalyptus trees at the hotel by the Malecon pier. It\'s a great spot to hang out for an afternoon.

280410435.name: Promenade along the lake
280410435.author: a TripAdvisor user
280410435.reviewBody: Lovely promenade - good for jogging or walking along the lake!   Nice views and safe.  Easy access from town square.

279722295.name: Best in the morning
279722295.author: a TripAdvisor user
279722295.reviewBody: It can get hot during the day, but a lovely early morning or early evening stroll.  There are benches for sitting and contemplating along the way.  People are using the exercise equipment, ladies are dancing in the Zumba class.  On weekends there are plenty of vendors and sometimes music.  You really never know what you will find.  A nice place to stop for a drink after a walk is Maria Isabel.  Very good people watching on the weekend.  I\'m glad it\'s here.

277755831.name: Would love to go back and visit
277755831.author: a TripAdvisor user
277755831.reviewBody: I think this is such a pretty spot was there in 1997 and haven\'t been back. There is so much to see around here and down the way is pottery places galore .

277619414.name: Great place to walk
277619414.author: a TripAdvisor user
277619414.reviewBody: Stroll along the lake, watch the families at play,horses with riders along the shore, many happy dogs!

277261993.name: Almost walking on water
277261993.author: a TripAdvisor user
277261993.reviewBody: This is a fine promenade along the shore of Lake Chapala. We\'d managed to be here during one of the few cold, rainy spells in recent March memory, so we were not suffering crowds, but the temp felt fine to a couple of Oregonians. There were still other sightseers, mostly families, doing the walk and enjoying the excellent displays of shore birds and migratory waterfowl, including pelicans. The high desert location of Lake Chapala, the largest freshwater lake in Mexico, makes is a special destination for both tourists and locals, though some of these villages are dominated by either the wealthy from Guadalajara or the large communities of Canadian and American expats and snowbirds.\n\nPartly because of the weather, we didn\'t hire a boat to cruise on the lake, but our leisurely walk along the Malecon gave us a chance to sample local street food and browse the small shops that line the way.

274178212.name: My Everyday Walk
274178212.author: a TripAdvisor user
274178212.reviewBody: The best wasy to start your day is walking the malecon.  Friendly people, yoga, zumba and just a beautiful walk near the lake.  It renews your faith in the beauty of life.

274099958.name: Awesome
274099958.author: a TripAdvisor user
274099958.reviewBody: Loved watching the birds and enjoying the sunsets at dusk. The Ajijic Malacon is a wonderful place to take a stroll and admire the beauty of Lake Chapala. The park is often a hive of activity with families enjoying picnics and youngsters on the swings. Sometimes there are youth playing volleyball and in the evenings many youngsters are using the skateboard park which has some awesome graffiti and murals too. Wonderful garden with Buddha statues that is very \'zen\'.

273226730.name: Great walk
273226730.author: a TripAdvisor user
273226730.reviewBody: The male on has been greatly improved over the past few years.  It is now paved for the entire length and is easily walked

271889244.name: Best sunsets ever....
271889244.author: a TripAdvisor user
271889244.reviewBody: The Malecon is one of the best and the most recent accomplishments of the Mexican people and the ex patriots\' community of Ajijic.  As you take a stroll on the Malecon, you can see the breathtaking sunsets over the Lake Chapala. \nThere are kids playing and laughing, families are spending their time together, pet lovers walking their dogs and meeting new friends.  Malecon is the place for the sport lovers.. One can either play or watch soccer, valleyball, scate boarding, etc. if you are one who loves to excersize at the gym, you can enjoy the equipment right at the Malecon. \nSo, take a walk on the Maleconn, get some delicious ice cream from the always smiling vendor, listen to the music, talk to the friendly locals and enjoy the sweet air of Mexico.

265840863.name: Nice place to hangout.
265840863.author: a TripAdvisor user
265840863.reviewBody: On some days there are several vendors (not pushy) selling handmade jewelry, weaving etc. Restaurants of all kinds are close by on the neighbouring streets if you need a bite.\nPlenty of space to stroll or jog if you prefer .Shady areas are available and parking is usually not a problem. Sundays are a bit too overcrowded for me though (Mexican families treasure Sunday to spend the day with.)  Benches are available if people watching is your thing.  It is an ON leash dog area but there are those who do not adhere to the rules. It is getting better though.

262362069.name: Just a Great Place11
262362069.author: a TripAdvisor user
262362069.reviewBody: We have been coming here for 4 years.  It is a great place to walk.  A great place to just look at the lake.  But my favorite is to watch the families.  If you come between 4 pm and dark, you will find the Mexican families gather here.  They will eating, kids will be playing, having fun on the beach, horseback riding, playing volleyball, skateboarding, flying kites, etc..

260159558.name: Always a pleasure!
260159558.author: a TripAdvisor user
260159558.reviewBody: The walk along the Ajijic Malecon is a pleasure on any day, at any time. On a busy day, it\'s a great place to see families and kids enjoying themselves all up and down the walkway, and bbq pits line one area so that people can stay for the day. On any day though, the view out over the lake is spectacular, and it\'s a comfortable \\ enjoyable way to get into town for those of us living in West Ajijic. Keeping your \'Buenos dias\' and \'Buenas tardes\' on hand will get you a smile and prompt return of the same, regardless of age. Love it!

259650107.name: Great place to see the Lake
259650107.author: a TripAdvisor user
259650107.reviewBody: Great on the weekend to see the families enjoying the beach.  Very pretty, with lots of shorebirds on the lake.

257136438.name: Walk with the locals
257136438.author: a TripAdvisor user
257136438.reviewBody: The Malecon is best on Sunday where it is the place to have fun, eat, drink and people watch.  Loved the locals coming on their horses in all their best dress.

256158421.name: Beautiful setting
256158421.author: a TripAdvisor user
256158421.reviewBody: Went to both the Chapala male on and Ajijic.  This one was far better...cleaner, better maintained area, etc.  We spent the better part of a Sunday just soaking up all the entertainment and people watching.

255612770.name: Ajijic Malecon
255612770.author: a TripAdvisor user
255612770.reviewBody: Wonderful spot for walks, flat even surface in contrast to the cobble streets of the village. Wonderful view of the lake and fun place to "people watch" at weekends as many Mexican families come to enjoy the area.

255397152.name: malecon de ajijic
255397152.author: a TripAdvisor user
255397152.reviewBody: I loved it before renovation and now love what has been done.   Incredible weekend morning or afternoon. I live here so course go down every day.  \nSo lovely

254854401.name: Perfect place to relax or run. The choice is yours!
254854401.author: a TripAdvisor user
254854401.reviewBody: No matter what you want to do, the Ajijic Malecon is probably the place to do it. It\'s a park, it\'s a garden, it\'s a lakeside walkway, and it\'s often a site for parties and fiestas. Add in a couple of outdoor restaurants/bars, a work-out area, a basketball court and a skateboard park, and it caters to everyone from dog-walkers to day-dreamers. Oh, and it\'s a bird-watchers paradise!

253455955.name: Smiles Everywhere
253455955.author: a TripAdvisor user
253455955.reviewBody: A young drum and bugle corps practicing their chops, sunsets with riders on horseback along the lakeshore, Saturday afternoon family picnics, ancient peanut vendor pedaling his cycle, smiles everywhere.

253228496.name: Awesome
253228496.author: a TripAdvisor user
253228496.reviewBody: Original art-crafts, colorful settings... Breath taking!  Excellent Street food, every one super nice!

253102280.name: Great views of the lake
253102280.author: a TripAdvisor user
253102280.reviewBody: The Malecon is always alive with activity, walkers, buskers and people selling their wares. Stroll for fun, power walk for exercise...it\'s all great!

252782141.name: sunset at the malecon
252782141.author: a TripAdvisor user
252782141.reviewBody: You want to be out on the Malecon as the setting sun reflects off the still waters of the lake and colors the sky in bright hues of crimson and pink.

252318141.name: great
252318141.author: a TripAdvisor user
252318141.reviewBody: enjoyed watching local people interact,families with their children,sunsets were beautiful,very clean

250961357.name: Great walking area with excellent views
250961357.author: a TripAdvisor user
250961357.reviewBody: This has been improved over the years and is now a beautiful walkway with lots of play space and cool, shady parts.\nWell utilised by the inhabitants and visitors

249759087.name: A pleasure to walk
249759087.author: a TripAdvisor user
249759087.reviewBody: "Malecon" is Spanish for a walkway along the waterfront. In a town paved with cobblestones and uneven sidewalks, this pathway along Lake Chapala runs from the pier west. On the weekends, the parkway along the Malecon is busy with families. The rest of the week, it\'s just a pleasant place to stroll. There is an outstanding playground for children and a skater\'s or biker\'s paradise of bowls and hills, decorated with graffiti -- but nice graffiti. Remember that painting on walls is a Mexican tradition. On the lakeside, you\'ll see flocks of pelicans and egrets feeding. There are no concessions along the Malecon but you\'re only a block or two from the busy streets of downtown Ajijic. You\'re going to get here eventually, so might as well make it a priority.

249588550.name: A walk on the lake
249588550.author: a TripAdvisor user
249588550.reviewBody: Well done walkway along the lake where you can just sit on a bench and watch the wonderful wildlife.  Many egrets, herons and pelicans fishing close to shore.

245557951.name: Great place to walk your dog
245557951.author: a TripAdvisor user
245557951.reviewBody: Certainly not as much here as on the Chapala malecon, but great place to take your dog for a walk or just to go for a stroll. The weekends are a bit busier with a few vendors and families picnicing in the park. Great way to get to the Plaza or the Wednesday Tianguis without having to walk through town.

245424473.name: Must do in Ajijic...
245424473.author: a TripAdvisor user
245424473.reviewBody: The Ajijic malecon on the lake is absolutely beautiful, all of it, at anytime of day or night!  Nothing to dislike here...

245376121.name: The Lake and volconic mountains
245376121.author: a TripAdvisor user
245376121.reviewBody: it is indeed a pleasant stroll. There are very few vendors on the Malecon. Runners and skaters, about all the people you will encounter as well as families just taking a stroll. The view is great. Also picnic tables if you want to bring a snack. It is the largest lake in Mexico. 2,2 miles long. The lake has  an interesting history going back to pre Hispanic days. Can\'t really fish it anymore for a number of reasons, A bit of a contrroversy. But houseboats and speed boats and a ferry to the other shore are available. Ferrys depend on the water level. It does fluctuate.

245160922.name: Delightful Walk
245160922.author: a TripAdvisor user
245160922.reviewBody: This was a bonus that we had not expected.  It is a pleasant walk along the shore of Lake Chapala.  The area was well planned and I very clean and interesting for a walk on the way to the shops near the water.

245007406.name: Daily Happiness Walk
245007406.author: a TripAdvisor user
245007406.reviewBody: Every evening, we go to the Malecon for our mile-walk (a round trip, end-to-end, is one mile. There is always somebody making music, somebody laughing, children playing, kids bicycling on the bicycle-skateboard court, and usually a game of basketball or badminton. The view across the lake of Mt. Garcia reminds me of Bali. We could be so many places in the world, and have been, but here we are in the most beautiful of all, Ajijic, Jalisco.

244882693.name: Layed back, quiet, charming
244882693.author: a TripAdvisor user
244882693.reviewBody: Take a stroll and enjoy children playing, parents spending time with their children, people walking their dogs and many friendly smiles and greetings. Delightful.

243194313.name: Intriguing malecon
243194313.author: a TripAdvisor user
243194313.reviewBody: I lived half-time in Ajijic for twelve years and am now full-time in Ajijic for an additional twelve. The addition of the malecon has been quite welcome.  It refurbished the area, provides a delightful walk and is a very good location for meeting all sorts of people. It\'s very easy, not particularly crowded, and is a good location for walking on level ground.  It\'s convenient to restaurant and shops and is a thoroughly delightful area for "dog-walking."  I think the addition of the malecon has greatly benefited Ajijic.

243009151.name: I\'m a Jersey boy...I love board walks!
243009151.author: a TripAdvisor user
243009151.reviewBody: If you are going to Ajijic, the Malecon or boardwalk should be visited.  To get to it, you\'ll have to pass some fun stores to browse and they, of course, cater to all the tourists.  I live in the area and so I feel that I must visit the Malecon, at least twice a year, just to remain connected to the community.  While we all wish that Lake Chapala\'s water level was higher, it\'s a great place to sit and enjoy the lake and people watch.  In the end, you can\'t say you\'ve been to Ajijic without saying you walked the Malecon.

241632916.name: Lakeside boardwalk.
241632916.author: a TripAdvisor user
241632916.reviewBody: Well not Board of course but wide concrete walkway five minutes walk from the Ajijic Town Square.Along with the square the Malecon is the place where locals and vistors can meet and where the community comes together every day and evening.Always something to see going on,dancing, musicians playing,children playing and well behaved. The Malecon is one of the charms of this lakeside village that is Ajijic.Marvelous!

241003387.name: Beautiful Walks Along the Lakefront
241003387.author: a TripAdvisor user
241003387.reviewBody: I lived in Guadalajara for 12 years in the past and have been in Ajijic several dozen times. This year my wife and I rented a condo for the winter months and went for a morning walk. Upon arriving near the lake we chanced to discover the Ajijic Malecon. It is over a kilometre of shear beauty. The views of the lake and mountains are awe inspiring and the nature off the shore or the lake is very interesting. Along the Malecon you are greeted by a vast assortment of locals and foreigners who very friendly and make you feel safe and at home. There are slides and swings for your children and also volleyball and basketball courts for the sports minded. There is also a high quality skate park for the skateboarder should you have one teenager so inclined. Now that I have discovered this special place I have no doubt that I will be spending time on The Malecon several times a week during my stay in the Chapala area.

240840267.name: Calm, enormous lake with lots of waterfowl!
240840267.author: a TripAdvisor user
240840267.reviewBody: Quiet beautiful! Clean sidewalks. Lots of friendly locals walking dogs. What\'s not to like? Surrounding small village: very picturesque!

240690678.name: The Malecon in Ajijic, Mexico
240690678.author: a TripAdvisor user
240690678.reviewBody: If your spirits need to be lifted this is the place to go.
