You meet and talk to a lot of people from all around the world or visit with the locals that take their daily walks there.  It is tranquil and fun.  You can choose to sit by yourself and meditate on the days events or join with the many other people there for a walk or a chat.  I have always felt a lot better after being on the Malecon in Ajijic.  I like to people watch there.  Or children watch, especially on the week ends and in the summer months.  Over all I think it is a great place to relax and get your day started.  When you visit Ajijic, don\'t miss this Malecon.

240226417.name: Nice morning walks
240226417.author: a TripAdvisor user
240226417.reviewBody: Beautiful morning walks. Wonderful area to people watch. Look out over this huge lake and watch the birds diving for their breakfast.

239638945.name: A pleasant walk on a sunny day
239638945.author: a TripAdvisor user
239638945.reviewBody: The Malecon runs 6 or 8 blocks along the waterfront of Lake Chapala in the village of Ajijic.  Expansive views of the 55-mile lake and the lush mountains that have an unmistakeable Hawaiian look about them.  Friendly people saying hello, friendly dogs running loose.  Parallel grass area with picnic tables.  No cost.  Try it out.  Bring a book and have a seat on the bench as you face the water.

239579824.name: Great view of lake and peaceful walk
239579824.author: a TripAdvisor user
239579824.reviewBody: This is a unique feature of ajijic. The new malecon is a great attraction of this town, in the morning you can observe the sunrise ,it\'s ever changing color is amazing. It\'s a heaven for walkers and dog lovers, great place to socialize and observe the local costumes,

238695129.name: Lovely Malecon on lake
238695129.author: a TripAdvisor user
238695129.reviewBody: Peaceful, pleasant clean malecon along the lake.  A must see as each pueblo has a malecon now.  Walk along, sit, stop for a drink, lunch or go shopping just up a street.

237915633.name: A GREAT PLACE TO WALK ... AND TALK
237915633.author: a TripAdvisor user
237915633.reviewBody: ... Or sit .. On a bench, contemplating.  Well maintained.  Busy on weekends, much quieter on weekdays.

235206489.name: Beautiful
235206489.author: a TripAdvisor user
235206489.reviewBody: Quiet, clean. Perfect for a family or with your dog. This is the best place to lazily waste away a Sunday afternoon.

231244665.name: Great place for a walk and people watching
231244665.author: a TripAdvisor user
231244665.reviewBody: We walk the Malecon almost every day.  The views of the Lake, the mountains, and the clouds are amazing.  Early morning during the week, you mostly see Gringos walking their dogs.  Mid day it\'s nearly deserted.  Later, there are lots of school kids planning soccer or basketball.  On the weekends it\'s really hopping.  Lots of families, especially on Sunday, picnicking or playing ball.  Vendors set up shop and it\'s a beautiful place to just walk or sit.  There is a section with exercise equipment -- best view I\'ve ever seen for exercising.

230003502.name: Great spot for a walk next to the lake.
230003502.author: a TripAdvisor user
230003502.reviewBody: This is terrific early in the morning.  It\'s a good, easy place to walk briskly then, much easier to navigate than the cobbled streets.  Pretty, well-tended gardens with outdoor exercise equipment.

227889952.name: Beautiful place to peopel watch.
227889952.author: a TripAdvisor user
227889952.reviewBody: Several cafes to sit in the shad and enjoy watching people. Cute little stands selling arts and crafts  on the path out of the Malecon.

226024305.name: Nice Walk
226024305.author: a TripAdvisor user
226024305.reviewBody: Great place to just wander, see the vendors, have lunch or sit and read watching the water and people.

223199005.name: Peaceful walk
223199005.author: a TripAdvisor user
223199005.reviewBody: Beautiful view of lake and surrounding hills. Saw looks of migrating birds. Lots of friendly people. Lots of internationals, mostly Canadians winter in this area. It\'s a wonderful no stress walk and village.  Great shopping and restaurants near by. Check out the weekend events there.

222251312.name: Lovely Dog Walk
222251312.author: a TripAdvisor user
222251312.reviewBody: We walk our dogs here every morning and evening.  It\'s a lovely way to begin and end the day.  Great place to see the sunrise and the sunset. See  www.artechapatlan.com for more attractions lakeside.

219486317.name: Beautiful
219486317.author: a TripAdvisor user
219486317.reviewBody: The Malecon in Ajijic was really nice to walk every morning, extremely clean and well kept with people just relaxing on the benches in the shade. The people were are all so nice, everyone said hello and we never saw any vendors walking and asked to buy something like in other spots in Mexico.

217801713.name: Love this Place
217801713.author: a TripAdvisor user
217801713.reviewBody: We walk our dogs here regularly. Beautiful sunsets, love watching the local children. Great place at sunset to get an ice cream and get some exercise. One of our favorite places for leisurely walking with the dogs.

217677174.name: Can\'t get enough of this place
217677174.author: a TripAdvisor user
217677174.reviewBody: Beautiful! Views of the sunrise and sunset daily from this north side of Lake Chapala. Families enjoy gathering at the park along the malecon every weekend. We were privileged to be there just prior to Easter and there were mariachi bands and many celebrations happening.\n\nCons:  Restroom at park is a pay-per-use, so be prepared. Otherwise, best to stop and buy a drink at a local restaurant and use their facilities.

217584670.name: Missing the Malecon
217584670.author: a TripAdvisor user
217584670.reviewBody: When we stayed in Ajijic we walked the malecon twice a day from our casita in 6 corners to Colon.  It is so lovely, sometimes quiet, sometimes filled with people, children, lovers, families.  the view of the lake is so wonderful it refreshed or energized depending on what we needed.

216704343.name: Wonderful walk
216704343.author: a TripAdvisor user
216704343.reviewBody: This is a wonderful place to stroll, particularly at sunset, when the lake and mountains in the background provide some spectacular sights.  It is well maintained and at weekends provides a place for the local inhabitants to enjoy a picnic.\nAlthough there are no restaurants on thr Malecon itself, there are any number within a couple of blocks.\nAivars T.

215412172.name: Stroll by Lake Chapala
215412172.author: a TripAdvisor user
215412172.reviewBody: The Malecon is the perfect place to enjoy views of Lake Chapala, the mountains in the distance, and the many birds which inhabit the lake.  There are some restaurants, and very attractive homes and gardens to enhance your experience.

215000854.name: OK for a walk but...
215000854.author: a TripAdvisor user
215000854.reviewBody: The malecon itself is nicely maintained.  It offers good views of the lake.  The walk itself is fairly short and other than the views, there isn\'t much to see.  The largest restaurant is abandoned and dilapated.  The "pier" also seems to be in great disrepair.  As others have note, the Chapala malecon is much better.  Go on a Sunday for the most action.

213106968.name: Walking on the Malecon
213106968.author: a TripAdvisor user
213106968.reviewBody: I was house and dog sitting in May, 2014 and took a walking on the Malecon everyday.  I goes along the lake shore for about a half mile.  There are steps down to the lakeshore at different points.  There are also benches on the Malecon to sit and just take in the sites of the beautiful lake and mountains.  This is a perfect place to meet friends and get some exercise or sit in the shade and watch the village go by.   There are several restaurants close by for breakfast or lunch.

212443930.name: Nice walks
212443930.author: a TripAdvisor user
212443930.reviewBody: Nice malecon to walk and relax along the shores of Lago Chapala\nNice breeze, beautiful scenery, great place to take photos, to watch horses and cowboys on the sand by the shore

209639208.name: Take a walk by the lake
209639208.author: a TripAdvisor user
209639208.reviewBody: We spent few quiet afternoons walking along the promenade sitting on a branch and enjoying the view. There are several restaurants along where you can have dinner and enjoy the lake. Also vendors with native rugs, hats, and other staff. Most of the time you\'ll see horses using the dried up shore as pasture. We enjoyed it as a quiet place to relax.

209599106.name: Just okay
209599106.author: a TripAdvisor user
209599106.reviewBody: As I walked down Colon for my first glimpse of the famed Ajijic malecon, the first thing I saw was the deserted building on the so-called pier. The views of the mountains, a lake smooth as marble, and horses majestically running free were magnificent. However, as an attraction, what\'s lacking are outdoor restaurants (save one) and benches with backs that would invite longer visits. Compared to other malecons in Mexico, this one disappoints.

207733493.name: A must see if in Ajijic
207733493.author: a TripAdvisor user
207733493.reviewBody: Be sure to walk the Malecon while staying in Ajijic or nearby.  This peaceful walk is a "go to place" for many on any day in Ajijic....an "up close and personal" experience of beautiful Lake Chapala.  It includes a skate park and work out machines.

203490008.name: Beautiful place to walk
203490008.author: a TripAdvisor user
203490008.reviewBody: What a lovely job Ajijic has done with their lakefront. Lots of fun there during the Easter celebrations. The water is way down but hopefully the rain will come.

202208933.name: a must
202208933.author: a TripAdvisor user
202208933.reviewBody: if you happen to be in ajijic , you must start at the plaza and visit the church and continue through colon street till you meet with the boardwalk, stroll at sunrise or at sunset is the best to view the multicolor rainbow change and the reflection on the water is amazing, see families stroll together, young lovers , older folks and lots of dog and cat lovers,

197333564.name: Fun Time
197333564.author: a TripAdvisor user
197333564.reviewBody: Great scene, but busy on the weekends! Lots of activity with music, parties and food. During the week it is very quiet and peaceful.

197331286.name: Nice Malecon
197331286.author: a TripAdvisor user
197331286.reviewBody:
The Ajijic Malecon is a wonder from early morning to evening. My wife and I, along with many others, walk along the Malecon for multiple laps. Besides the peacefulness of Lake Chapala, the wild aquatic birds and local fishermen contribute to the magic of the area.

Weekends are alive with families, events and activities.

An almost magical place.

196482093.name: Great place for a stroll
196482093.author: a TripAdvisor user
196482093.reviewBody: Great place for a walk and view of the lake. Lots to entertain to entertain families, especially on the weekend

196437746.name: Lovely sunset
196437746.author: a TripAdvisor user
196437746.reviewBody: Went and strolled along the Malecon on Valentine\'s Day.  It was so nice to see the couples down strolling and sitting along the water.  The sunset was just beautiful.

196071946.name: Come and take a walk!
196071946.author: a TripAdvisor user
196071946.reviewBody: This is a favorie place of mine.  It\'s an easy stroll along the lake and a wonderful place to take the kids and dogs. There\'s playground equipment, a small skate board area and even a fitness area.  There are vendors selling nuts/candy/etc.  What they need is a couple resturants where you could sit and have a drink while watching the beautiful sunset.\n\nBe sure to take some pesos with you for the bathrooms.  They are individually maintained at lots of places and will cost you about 30 pesos per visit.

195955285.name: Wonderful stroll along the lake!
195955285.author: a TripAdvisor user
195955285.reviewBody: Great evening walk with beautiful views of sun setting behind the mountains and reflecting off the lake.

195629580.name: Great sunsets at the lake
195629580.author: a TripAdvisor user
195629580.reviewBody: Wonderful place to walk or sit and watch the waves roll onto the shore.  Always a nice breeze.  Weekend full of family picnics, children riding bikes.  Weekdays full of people walking their dogs and just taking a stroll, enjoying the fresh air.

194201507.name: worth the trip
194201507.author: a TripAdvisor user
194201507.reviewBody: Lots of art, art galleries, fun shops - cobble stone streets. We were staying in Chapala, took the bus to Ajijic - it was an easy trip and very enjoyable.

193258784.name: Lovely to walk along
193258784.author: a TripAdvisor user
193258784.reviewBody: Bring a jacket as the wind off the lake can be chilly. Stop for coffee or lunch buffet at the restaurant near the pier over looking the lake.

190344819.name: Wonderful weather
190344819.author: a TripAdvisor user
190344819.reviewBody: Easy to get around. Little towns around the lake to visit s well. It is only 1 hour to Guadalajari,  where the history is remarkable. Second best climate in the world!  Worth putting on your bucket list

189040826.name: Good picnic spot
189040826.author: a TripAdvisor user
189040826.reviewBody: We enjoyed sitting down in the sun and watching all the groups at the picnic area.  There were many big group parties with pinata\'s and lots of food.  It was a short walk from our B&B.  We did bring a picnic and ate it sitting on the benches facing the lake.  There were many strolling vendors with sweets or food who were not pushy or rude.  All the vendors were polite and their products were equally enjoyable.

188896689.name: Great views
188896689.author: a TripAdvisor user
188896689.reviewBody: It\'s a nice stroll when the sun isn\'t hitting too heavily.  I remember this area before the malecon was built, and it\'s definitely an improvement.  The views of the lake are spectacular and the area around the path is kept quite clean.  There are swing sets for kids as well.  Vendors selling snacks and indigenous textiles are also present during the day. The only negative is that one is reminded of how polluted the lake is by walking alongside it.  It\'s not suitable for swimming at all.

188408345.name: Beautiful Views
188408345.author: a TripAdvisor user
188408345.reviewBody: Very clean and well maintained.  Now if they could just get a restaurant to survive.  To see a horse and variety of birds there was amazing.

187812753.name: What a difference landscape and walkways make!
187812753.author: a TripAdvisor user
187812753.reviewBody: The Malecon is a wonderful place to stroll and relax, either after lunch or dinner, or for a morning exercise walk.  The beautiful lake is lovely!

186939895.name: lakeside
186939895.author: a TripAdvisor user
186939895.reviewBody: The malecon in Ajijic is a paved boardwalk with the lake on one side and the park, playground, fitness circuit, skate park, and trails on the other. A whole lot for about 1/2 mile long. It is safe, well patrolled by the police and well used by young and old.

186679116.name: Malecon for Relaxing
186679116.author: a TripAdvisor user
186679116.reviewBody: Beautiful and peaceful.  Easy to relax while looking at the beautiful Lake Chapala and watching the birds.

186595230.name: Great walking malecon
186595230.author: a TripAdvisor user
186595230.reviewBody: Ajijic malecon is peaceful, pleasant, well kept and right on lake. A definite must see is in the area.

186119934.name: Lovely, Lovely
186119934.author: a TripAdvisor user
186119934.reviewBody: They have done a great job renovating the malecon. It is such a pleasure to walk along it and stop at one of the restaurants . It is kept clean and the view at night, at sunset is spectacular.\nCertainly a jewel for Chapala.

185805211.name: Perfect place for a picnic!
185805211.author: a TripAdvisor user
185805211.reviewBody: This relatively new edition to the lakeside landscape is a welcomed one! The malecon is a wide paved walkway between the lake and picnic/park areas. You can sit on a bench and watch the daily committed clocked speed walkers, enjoy the leashed pets being pampered or just sit still and bird or sunset watch! The malecons are also in place in towns to the East and a West. Chapala\'s is wide, wonderful and the manicured parks are almost empty. Brightly painted play grounds with no players! Ajijic is also enjoying a skate park in the same area. There is also a litter free campaign in place throughout the area and town. There are restaurants nearby for lunch; but a nice family friendly cafe right on the malecon would be a nice addition!

185802401.name: Malecon beauty
185802401.author: a TripAdvisor user
185802401.reviewBody: The renovation of the Malecon has made it one of the more pleasant areas of Ajijic.  Many people, locals and tourists, can be seen walking its length along the lake morning and evening, especially at sunset.

185795400.name: Ajijic Malecon
185795400.author: a TripAdvisor user
185795400.reviewBody: If you are strolling westward on the malecon, look up to the hills on your front right and you\'ll see the eagle on the hills in the distance--beak facing to its left, wings extended.  For thousands of years, no greenery has grown on this image, although the soil and stone surrounding it is green.  The only greenery in the image is one tree that forms the eye.  This is the best place to view this phenomenon that is is rumored caused the Aztecs to pause here for a number of years, thinking this was the "eagle with a snake in its mouth" that marked the place they were supposed to settle.  A wonderful place to watch the sunrise, sunset, or any other time of day--and to observe culture.  Strollers, families picnicking in the park, children playing in the playground.  If you are lucky, there will be an art display by various artists.  During Day of the Dead, a fantastic exhibit of giant Katrinas..

184402019.name: Nice stroll!
184402019.author: a TripAdvisor user
184402019.reviewBody: Its a lovely place for those early morning walks and evening strolls. Perfect place for your photo ops.

181561718.name: Clean, beautiful and serene
181561718.author: a TripAdvisor user
181561718.reviewBody: One of Ajijic\'s treasures.  Just a few blocks south of September 16.  Visited on saturday morning, and it was quiet, beautiful and serene.  We were told that later on that day is would get much busier with the locals, but that would not detract from its beauty.

181320686.name: Beautiful and Mostly Deserted
181320686.author: a TripAdvisor user
181320686.reviewBody: This is a beautiful walk along Lake Chapala, mostly deserted during the day. Nice playground for families with children. Great views of the lake and good for bird watching.

180402125.name: Great place to enjoy a relaxing walk
180402125.author: a TripAdvisor user
180402125.reviewBody: You will see some local and visitor families. Enjoy a great evening waking while having a fresh breeze coming from the lake and the excellent mountain view. There are some close restaurants and bars. Walking with your pets and get to chance to even see some wildlife on the water for those bird lovers and even some horses along the lake shore. Clean, safe and beautiful. Bring your camera, it is really worth it!

178067019.name: Nice place
178067019.author: a TripAdvisor user
178067019.reviewBody: That\'s  a good place to walk along, many people doing picnics on the grass, barbecue on the kiosks. \n\nThe landscape is beautiful and many options of restaurants nad bars to chill out.

176807992.name: ajijic waterfront malecon
176807992.author: a TripAdvisor user
176807992.reviewBody: We live about two blocks from the western end and often take the dogs on walks along the waterfront.  Nice area to stroll and view the lake, have a picnic, or just sit on one of the benches and read a book.  \n\nWhat a fantastic addition to Ajijic and with a playground, picnic area and some artwork it is fantastic.

176761997.name: Tranquility
176761997.author: a TripAdvisor user
176761997.reviewBody: The Ajijic malecon is 1/4 mile (one way) along Lake Chapala at the base of the town.  The mornings are filled with dog walkers joggers and those out to get a bit of exercise while enjoying the lake and mountain views and feeling the soft mountain breeze.

174421470.name: Ajijic Malecon Review
174421470.author: a TripAdvisor user
174421470.reviewBody: The Ajijic Malecon is a great place to take a walk (with you dog too), ride a bike, or get some exercise.  Right next to the lake, it offers a great view.  On the side of it, there is a playground, picnic benches with grills, and outdoor exercise equipment.  Check out the malecon if you want a relaxing time.

172515545.name: A Wonderful Way to Unwind
172515545.author: a TripAdvisor user
172515545.reviewBody: Walking along the Malecon in Ajijic, is a time to do deep breathing and re-connect to natural and the water. The breeze on a warm day is very refreshing. It is always uplifting walking up and down the malecon. Also, a great place to meditate. If you are a people watcher this place is for you.

171718582.name: Stroll down the malecon
171718582.author: a TripAdvisor user
171718582.reviewBody: If you feel like a good morning stroll, this is an ideal place.\nYou have Lake Chapala on one side and different things to see\non the other (gym equipment, a little outdoor arena, a skateboard area to mention a few)  Actually, people stroll here at all hours of the day.  I just like the mornings.

170766170.name: A Can\'t-Miss Part of Your Visit to Ajijic
170766170.author: a TripAdvisor user
170766170.reviewBody: If you\'re a new visitor to Ajijic - or even if you\'ve been there before - you really MUST visit the Ajijic Malecon.  It\'s a lovely spot to take in the beauty of Lake Chapala and the surrounding mountains.  Most of the week the tranquility of the malecon is a perfect complement to the natural beauty of the area - that is, apart from the one small area devoted to the young skateboarders - but even they are relatively "tranquil," at least for skateboarders.  Sundays provide a people-watching taste of real Mexico, as families congregate for picnics and barbeques.  And, you\'re only a few steps from "Colon, the main street in Ajijic, full of attractive shops and restaurants.  For a larger malecon with more touristic hustle and bustle, and with equally beautiful views of the lake, also be sure to visit the malecon in nearby Chapala.  Don\'t miss either one!

170683399.name: My back yard
170683399.author: a TripAdvisor user
170683399.reviewBody: great place to watch the sun set over the lake and mountains ....... you can walk your dog and meet friendly dogs and locals ...... drop a line in the water using a small piece of taco as bait for a fun catch and release .....especially love to watch the rain crossing the lake ....last week we had 2 water spouts ....WOO HOO

170154506.name: Waterfront.
170154506.author: a TripAdvisor user
170154506.reviewBody: This malecon is short but beautiful.  Since I can\'t go to the ocean this must do.  It\'s peaceful.  At least during the week.

169685004.name: Strolling on the Ajijic Malecon
169685004.author: a TripAdvisor user
169685004.reviewBody: The beautiful malecon (in English it would be called a boardwalk, but made of concrete and tiles, not boards), is lined with palms and has many benches to rest, lights for early mornings or evenings, a playground for the children, a concrete area with concrete hills and valleys for bikers and skateboarders, and a great exercise area with marvelous equipment if walking isn\'t enough for you.  The walkway is very wide and pets are permitted - a very good place to socialize your puppies.  Lake Chapala, Mexico\'s largest lake, laps the edge of the malecon when its level is up to normal, which it isn\'t now nor was it back in 2003 when we first arrived, but for many years it has been full and it will be again.  The malecon is also on the edge of Ajijic Village and walking distance to many of the most popular restaurants and boutique shops...a great area for tourists and residents alike.

169683926.name: Take a Walk!
169683926.author: a TripAdvisor user
169683926.reviewBody: As I suggested...take a walk and enjoy the view and the air. A great addition to the area. I walk it often as I lived not too far from the Malecon.

169658180.name: Great Walk Way
169658180.author: a TripAdvisor user
169658180.reviewBody: Only reason I take one "star" off is because there are owners who don\'t pick up dog poop after their dogs make a deposit. Most people do though. This is a wonderful walk-way on the shore of Lake Chapala. The city did a great job of creating a palm lined place to stroll and enjoy the perfect weather. There is also a world-class skate-board section for kids to enjoy.

168613484.name: Good value for your money
168613484.author: a TripAdvisor user
168613484.reviewBody:
Ajijic Suites is a reasonably priced, small, well run hotel which is also conveniently located.  It is a short walk to the plaza and many good restaurants. In the hotel, there are free phones, one for international calling and one for local calls. There is a computer available and they have Wifi. 

Elaine and Luis are friendly, helpful and attentive hosts. Elaine was always available for my questions and she gave me great suggestions on what to do and where to go. She went out of her way to make my stay a VERY comfortable one!!!  She is a sweet, caring and kind person. I was going to stay for one month but then ended up staying 2 weeks longer.

I found the village of Ajijic to be an extremely friendly place and even made a few friends during my short stay.  There is a wonderful thermal spa located just a short bus ride away. It is in the town of San Juan Cosala. I stayed there all day on two different occasions. There is a lot going on at Lake Chapala Society, an expat organization that has classes and events for both expats and Mexicans, a great resource which I used many times during my stay.    

I stayed for the month of April and the first two weeks in May.  Everyday was sunny and beautiful. Lake Chapala really does have the one of the best climates in the world!!

165444756.name: Nice for  a walk
165444756.author: a TripAdvisor user
165444756.reviewBody: in the morning or evening after dinner. Everyone says the lake is low now so we hope it rains a lot but not on our vacation

164274342.name: Excelent Vacation in Ajijic
164274342.author: a TripAdvisor user
164274342.reviewBody: The best, the Hotel tres leones, an amazing place, every thing was great, the weather, place, town, restaurants as Roberto\u00b4s, el Tango and number 4, very good, all was great

162549488.name: Pleasant walk by the lake
162549488.author: a TripAdvisor user
162549488.reviewBody: Nicely renovated and extended. Pleasant during the week, but too crowded for me on weekends. Trees still need to grow in order to provide more shade. Hot in the sun.

159628370.name: A peaceful stroll along Lake Chapala
159628370.author: a TripAdvisor user
159628370.reviewBody: The Ajijic malecon on the shores of Lake Chapala is a fine testament to the people of Ajijic. It is wide enough to accommodate those who walk (with or without their dogs), bicyclists, joggers and those like me who just stroll. Catch a sunset and cool breeze in the dry season or enjoy the warm evening rain in the wetter and greener summer months. If you enjoy watching families interact in simple pleasures, come on weekends. Peace and quiet in the early mornings of most week days.

158619683.name: Beautiful scenic walk
158619683.author: a TripAdvisor user
158619683.reviewBody: The Malecon is a very relaxing way to begin or end your day.  My husband and I strolled many times during our stay in Ajijic.  We were there during the Easter holidays and we enjoyed seeing all the families enjoying themselves, whether they were having a picnic or just relaxing along the lakefront.

158533368.name: Peaceful Malecon on the Lake..
158533368.author: a TripAdvisor user
158533368.reviewBody: Greta place to roam, walk, enjoy the Lake...restaurants line the area, walkers, and just up the side streets is shopping...

158056671.name: A great improvement to the water front at Ajijic
158056671.author: a TripAdvisor user
158056671.reviewBody: A nice wide walking promenade along the lakeshore. It is  great place for people watching! Lots of families, teenagers and visitors stroll along the malecon.

155634951.name: Beautiful Ajijic
155634951.author: a TripAdvisor user
155634951.reviewBody: Ajijic is so pretty with its flowering Jacaranda trees and flowers especially the bougainvillea and bird of paradise. The lake and mountains make a beautiful setting for all the towns.

154552867.name: Wonderful strolling
154552867.author: a TripAdvisor user
154552867.reviewBody: A beautiful, gentle stroll along this malencon-generally very quiet, easy access to beach with much birdlife.

154546077.name: A beautiful Sunday stroll
154546077.author: a TripAdvisor user
154546077.reviewBody: We walked that malecon on a beautiful March Sunday early evening. There were so many people and families eating, playing, strolling and enjoying the the lakefront.

153283495.name: Beautiful boardwalk... picture lovers
153283495.author: a TripAdvisor user
153283495.reviewBody: Any time of the day is great to take a walk.But especially just before sunset to get some great pictures.Get up early and walk the beach on the east side of the malecon just past La Nueva posada to get some beautiful sunrises.The malecon is full of life and families having fun.

153252123.name: Malecon adds lakeside charm
153252123.author: a TripAdvisor user
153252123.reviewBody: Well built/nicely designed. The new(ish) malecon adds a park-like setting for long walk along Ajijic\'s scenic lake.

152299539.name: Malecon Walk
152299539.author: a TripAdvisor user
152299539.reviewBody: Wonderful park for walking the dog, reading a book, taking the children to the playground.  The clean and well kept malecon a delight for children and seniors alike and everyone in between.

151487978.name: A nice place for a stroll
151487978.author: a TripAdvisor user
151487978.reviewBody: Ajijic is a geat little place to visit, the main square has a couple of excelent resteraunts located off of it. The one in the N.E. corner is great. Beside it upstairs on the balcoony enjoy a beautiful view of the square.Had french toast there was like churos, great. The waterfront where the Malecon is bsically is just a walk area with no shops etc. For a great Malecon go to neighbouring Chapala

150515383.name: Friendly and warm, Ajijic, Jalisco, Mexico
150515383.author: a TripAdvisor user
150515383.reviewBody:
December 2012
A few weeks ago Bob and I made our first visit to Ajijic, Jalisco, Mexico, a possible retirement site for us. We had read that it’s climate was perfect year round and that there were many services due to the large number of expatriates living in the area.  Our concern as we near retirement is the cost of living as our retirement income will be significantly less than our working income.

We arrived in the late afternoon and were picked up at the Guadalajara airport  by the Ajijic Suites Hotel co-owner, Luis. It was nice to have the pre-arranged pick up at the airport…one less worry.  Luis told us about the area as we rode to Ajijic. The area consists of small towns and villages around the very large Lake Chapala, surrounded by mountains.  Very beautiful.  The Ajijic Suites were very charming, clean and comfortable. The hotel is central and within walking distance to the plaza, restaurants and shopping. Elaine, the co-owner, and Luis’ wife, gave us many tips and advice throughout our week-long stay. I believe Luis is available to give certain tours for a nominal fee. They both made us feel welcomed and comfortable. There is free wifi and telephones available in the lobby for local Mexican calls and calls to the U.S. The tap water is not potable and so you will find a container in the bathroom filled with potable water for brushing your teeth, as well as potable water in the kitchenette and refrigerator. It is where we will be staying on our second trip to Ajijic.   Ajijic Suites Hotel has a good website, just google Ajijic Suites on Calle Hidalgo #72.

 The weather was beautiful, around 70-75 degrees Fahrenheit. The mornings and later evenings were cooler and a light sweater is advised.  For those of you who have not traveled into the interior of Mexico: because of the sewer systems, toilet paper cannot be put into the toilets and a bagged receptacle is there for this purpose.  This is the rule everywhere in this area.  Despite the picture that may come into your head, it is not a difficult thing to get used to.  My tip, buy a portable hand bidet or plastic, squeezable bottle. The toilets are very clean and no foul smells.

Our first night we ate in a restaurant called El Tango. A very nice restaurant but with very little Mexican food. We had pasta that was very delicious. We arrived about 4:30 p.m.and soon after, the restaurant was packed with Americans and other expatriates! We tried, unsuccessfully twice to go again but the waiting was from one to two hours….go early (4 pm) to get in. There are many other wonderful restaurants in Ajijic, many with American themes and owned by Americans. We especially liked the food at the Early Bird Cafe and the Bird of Paradise Restaurant.

.We were fortunate to be in Ajijic when the annual Mexican Artisan Art Fair was being held. The most beautiful and high quality folk art was for sale and several presentations (how to wear a rebozo and others) made the adventure even more interesting.

Since we had no car we did lots of walking. This was not that easy considering the streets are a very rough cobblestone. Some sidewalks were pretty good though. If you like to wear heels, bring walking shoes and a bag to carry your heels. I did see a few women with heels but you would have to walk slowly and carefully.

Bob and I took the bus to  Guadalajara (50 pesos ($4.00) each, which took about 40 minutes. It was an easy venture. Buy the ticket on the bus but be careful to use the “Directo” bus or you will be stopping at every town and it will take you much longer.. At the bus station in Guadalajara we took a taxi to Tonala for some shopping. This was farther than we expected but cost around 100 pesos (about $8.00).

Overall our experience was very good. Our accommodations were clean, nice and comfortable. The people of Ajijic were very friendly, and everywhere you go people speak English. If you are American and need to be near Americans to feel comfortable, this is the place for you. Americans everywhere! The food in the restaurants was excellent. The cost was very reasonable although not as inexpensive as we expected. We were told that costs were less in the other villages. Everyone we met was willing to give us advice about living in the Lake Chapala area. We plan to make our second visit  this coming summer. 
Bob and Rosa Killips, Michigan, USA

145261993.name: Local improvements
145261993.author: a TripAdvisor user
145261993.reviewBody: I was impressed that a local couple took it upon themselves to improve the area by paying to have the area cleaned up, put in new garbage cans, a newly created bench and potted flowers along one part of the Malecon... well done John and Linda.

145191823.name: Relaxation at its best.
145191823.author: a TripAdvisor user
145191823.reviewBody: It\'s gorgeous and I hope it never gets busy on the weekends with Tapatios like Chapala. It\'s mostly finished but there\'s still some work that is being done (eg building stairs to the beach.) There are areas for your bbq and some picnic tables...a skate park for the kids on the west end and in between, some playgrounds for the younger kids.

144562337.name: a view of relaxed Mexico
144562337.author: a TripAdvisor user
144562337.reviewBody: Take a walk along the well lighted and well kept Malecon and just soak it all up. Take a look and a listen of all that is going on around you and enjoy. You will get to see a beautiful sunset if your timing is right along with all the others who have come out to enjoy the day along side the lake in a clean and safe setting.

143697942.name: Ajijic Malecon aye que rico!!
143697942.author: a TripAdvisor user
143697942.reviewBody: I hadn\'t been to Ajijic in 10 years.....at that time there was no malecon, just a polluted lake.  In Sept. 2012 I was delighted to find the lake sparkling, people walking up and down the malecon, children playing, and no yucky smells coming from the Lake.  There were many areas designated for different activities such as an amphitheater, a special section designed for skateboarding enthusiasts with different architectural elements to enhance their experience.  It was so nice to see so many people of different ages enjoying the lakeside.  I understand that boat tours are offered around Lake Chapala but we didn\'t have the time to indulge.  Ajijic is alive and well, despite all the negative hype from the media.  Our trip was delightful and very relaxing.  Cannot wait to go back in April!!

143466734.name: Lovely walk in the mornings
143466734.author: a TripAdvisor user
143466734.reviewBody: There is no better place to stroll, or to walk your dog than the malec\u00f3n.  Beautiful scenery.  Not so keen on the new skate park... but if you go in the morning, you should be okay!

141532670.name: Good for a jog
141532670.author: a TripAdvisor user
141532670.reviewBody: Went out each morning to jog and enjoy this beautiful lake. I am told the malecon is new and they did a good job. Nice to see everyone enjoying it.

139943404.name: Nice place for a stroll
139943404.author: a TripAdvisor user
139943404.reviewBody: Great place to people watch on a Sunday when all the local people come out to relax, eat and enjoy their families.

139936350.name: spot to watch the sunset
139936350.author: a TripAdvisor user
139936350.reviewBody: best on weekends when filled with families and vendors.... there is also a ferry you can take to a village across the lake

138225374.name: Beauty on the Lake
138225374.author: a TripAdvisor user
138225374.reviewBody: Visit during the week and it\'s a peaceful, beautiful place to stroll with view across Lake Chapala to the mountains across.  On weekends if you like people watching m especially the Mexican children at play, this can be a place of entertainment!

137380202.name: Pleasant walk.
137380202.author: a TripAdvisor user
137380202.reviewBody: Especially fun on Sunday when local families are enjoying it, too. Here\'s where you get to view the lives of Mexicans and watch darling children, lovers, dudes and chicks all strolling and enjoying life.

136487307.name: Great views
136487307.author: a TripAdvisor user
136487307.reviewBody: The Ajijic malecon is a nice lakeside walkway with wonderful water and mountain views. I noticed some of the photos both here and on the Chapala forum seem to mix the two malecons. The one in Chapala is more extensive and a bit more developed. Boih are quite nice, though.

136059570.name: too short for a walk or biking
136059570.author: a TripAdvisor user
136059570.reviewBody: Nice view, clean, safe, no graffiti, green, well maintained.\nHowever, too short for a walk or biking.

133323528.name: exercise on the malecon
133323528.author: a TripAdvisor user
133323528.reviewBody: you  can walk, jog, walk your dog, or just sit and relax on a bench on the wonderful Ajijic malecon. The sunsets are spectacular. Or the sunrises if you prefer. \n

132185844.name: Very pretty malecon along the lake, a must see.
132185844.author: a TripAdvisor user
132185844.reviewBody: Nice for strolling, checking out the view of the lake and mountains.

132120048.name: Best of the small town malecons.
132120048.author: a TripAdvisor user
132120048.reviewBody: Great breezes off the lake and lots of family activity in the park. Great way to end the day - take a walk on the malecon.

131014699.name: this is a wonderful view of paradiso
131014699.author: a TripAdvisor user
131014699.reviewBody: Hopefully the plan to connect all the lakefront malecons eventually comes to fruition-As each one has its own beauty-What a wonderful walk!!!

130991059.name: Great place to run
130991059.author: a TripAdvisor user
130991059.reviewBody: It is an elegant malecon, and was perfect for running in the morning, while others strolled.

130952636.name: Relaxing place to walk
130952636.author: a TripAdvisor user
130952636.reviewBody: Very scenic although water levels are low now. Could use more services in the area.

130494348.name: Quiet stroll along  Lake Chapala
130494348.author: a TripAdvisor user
130494348.reviewBody: Beautiful location for a walk. Mountain and lake views, extremely well designed walkway beside the lake.

128945271.name: Wonderful Walk with Lake view
128945271.author: a TripAdvisor user
128945271.reviewBody: One of the few level surfaces to walk on in the village.  Just down from the plaza, this makes for a easy 30 to 60 minute stroll.  Busy on Sundays with lots of locals.  Almost any day of the week there is a social atmosphere.  If you enjoy this try the Malecon in Chapala - very similar just larger and busier.

128404186.name: Nice walk
128404186.author: a TripAdvisor user
128404186.reviewBody: Nice walk along the lake. Nice children\'s park/playground and picnic area too.

126632501.name: Pleasant
126632501.author: a TripAdvisor user
126632501.reviewBody: Nice place to stroll and people watch.  Busy on weekends.

125855434.name: Morning walk
125855434.author: a TripAdvisor user
125855434.reviewBody: Alot of folks walk here in the morning.  A great place to watch the sun rise and get your blood flowing.

125517248.name: Wonderful place to watch the world walk by
125517248.author: a TripAdvisor user
125517248.reviewBody: The evening breeze the easy walking and able to sit and people watch.

125323056.name: This is the place to walk and be seen
125323056.author: a TripAdvisor user
125323056.reviewBody: The malecon provides one of the only places in Ajijic that you can walk not on cobblestones, so it is great for a couple early morning exercise laps.  On the weekend it is transformed to a family outing extravaganza as folks bring tents, the whole BBQ and the extended family.  The area is a favorite for visitors from Guadalajara on the weekends too.  \n

125253950.name: Lovely Walk along the lake
125253950.author: a TripAdvisor user
125253950.reviewBody: Lovely cement walkway along the lake. Perfect in the right weather. No traffic of course and a smooth safe path. Great view of the massive lake.

124342644.name: Nice place to walk in early evening.
124342644.author: a TripAdvisor user
124342644.reviewBody: It\'s quiet, restful, peaceful and the sunset that particular evening was spectacular.  I went with friends to join a group of "drummers" who gather once a month to play different styles and shapes of drums and other percussion instruments.  They have a leader and even if you haven\'t played before you can quickly learn.  Restaurants are within walking distance but you have to get used to the cobble-stoned streets.  Lovely town and lake.

124292842.name: I love this town
124292842.author: a TripAdvisor user
124292842.reviewBody: This is  a treasure town, the real Mexico.  Full of amazing people, lots of Americans and Uropeans come to retire to this town because of it\'s magic. If you visit Guadalajara you have to drive to Ajjijic.

123973356.name: The Malecon
123973356.author: a TripAdvisor user
123973356.reviewBody: Beautifully done...enjoyed by locals and visitors alike.  Shows off the lake.

123786682.name: Wonderful for strolling in the sunset
123786682.author: a TripAdvisor user
123786682.reviewBody: A great place to stroll and people watch as well as take in the breath-taking sunsets over the lake.

122782873.name: The Lake
122782873.author: a TripAdvisor user
122782873.reviewBody: Really nice to just walk around the lake and enjoy the day watching the venders and families enjoying the perfect weather.

122260265.name: At the Lake
122260265.author: a TripAdvisor user
122260265.reviewBody: Great place to walk around or just hang out, lots of neat stuff to buy.

122245450.name: Peaceful Place to Unwind
122245450.author: a TripAdvisor user
122245450.reviewBody: It was nice to watch the local families on a Sunday afternoon with the kids playing. There is a restaurant at the end of the pier as well as one beach side. We didn\'t eat at either so no opinion there.

122033119.name: Nice view of the lake.
122033119.author: a TripAdvisor user
122033119.reviewBody: Nice little walk along the edge of the lake.  Good views of the sunset.

121839112.name: Lovely park along the lake
121839112.author: a TripAdvisor user
121839112.reviewBody: Murals, lovely views, family vibes, friendly people, safe, relaxing, fresh air. A little boring. Would be better with live music, theater, rentals, etc. Be sure to eat a meal at Yves\' while you are there....

121777287.name: Sunday Ajijic Malecon
121777287.author: a TripAdvisor user
121777287.reviewBody: The Malecon is PACKED on Sundays with vendors, food and liquor

121767803.name: Beautiful view
121767803.author: a TripAdvisor user
121767803.reviewBody: Beautiful new malecon. Great for a stroll along the lake.

121641734.name: Ajijic Mexico is Wonderful
121641734.author: a TripAdvisor user
121641734.reviewBody:
In late November 2011 I discovered the delightful Mexican town of Ajijic (south of Chapala). Ajijc is an interesting blending of two communities living harmoniously on the shore of Lake Chapala: Mexican and retired Canadian and American expats.  Both groups graciously went out of their way to make me feel comfortable, informed and entertained.  I enjoyed wandering the cobblestone streets where I discovered many interesting shops and restaurants.  On my solo strolls on the Malecon in the early morning and late evening, I met wonderfil Mexicans who enjoyed my laughable attempts at communication in Spanish--- a real ice breaker.

If staying at Estrellita's, an exquisite first rate little gem of a B&B filled with some of the best crafts Mexico has to offer, your visit to Sjijic will be complete.  Lorraine will make sure of that!

Valerie,
Toronto, Canada

121326676.name: Lake front Malecon
121326676.author: a TripAdvisor user
121326676.reviewBody: This is a lovely place to stroll along the lake front.  It\'s well done.  There are picnic tables, and playground equipment in a grassy area.

121244866.name: An important contribution to Ajijic
121244866.author: a TripAdvisor user
121244866.reviewBody: Ajijic town is great for just walking around, but one always has to be looking down at the pavement and it is unwise to really stride out. The Malecon has to be considered a significant addition even if its only function was to allow one to get out and walk.  But of course its designers have produced something with a lot of additional benefits. There are benches all along it to allow one to view the lake or have a little hand carried lunch. Local people now picnic on the grass behind it. The view is of course very nice indeed. The Malecon itself lacks eating places, but at least five are within a block of its eastern end.

121087972.name: Malecon
121087972.author: a TripAdvisor user
121087972.reviewBody: This has really improved the waterfront in Ajijic making for a nice stroll along the lake.

120661181.name: place on weekends that all the families come and enjoy
120661181.author: a TripAdvisor user
120661181.reviewBody: We strolled with a beer in hand and the locals are so friendly

120479107.name: Great place to relax and enjoy
120479107.author: a TripAdvisor user
120479107.reviewBody: Ajijic\'s malecon is right off the main street, Colon, going down through the center of the village, lakeside off the caraterra.   It stretches along the lakefront and you can walk, or sit and just enjoy the beautiful weather and soft breeze blowing in off the lake.\nThe Ajijic is not a commercial area, in fact, there is only one place to grab a snack or a drink and that\'s Tequilla Republic, so there really isn\'t a lot of noise, other than children playing on the playground that borders the walkway.  You\'ll see lots of walkers and joggers on any weekday morning, and families out for a stroll in the later afternoon and evening.\nIt\'s a beautiful place to just sit back and take it all in, the views are fantastic.

120384480.name: Nice but......
120384480.author: a TripAdvisor user
120384480.reviewBody: Nice but the Chapala Malecon is better, but the town of Ajijic is much nicer with much more to offer.

120118175.name: Breathtaking
120118175.author: a TripAdvisor user
120118175.reviewBody: Walk along the shores of Lake Chapala, morning, noon or night. The malecon is wonderful. Fun for all - gringos, Mexican families, youngsters etc. Whats not to like?

118655275.name: A great addition to the Ajijic waterfront!
118655275.author: a TripAdvisor user
118655275.reviewBody: What a wonderful new feature for the lakefront area of Ajijic.  In the past, this very same area would have been described as "shoddy" at best.  Now one sees people walking dogs, families strolling and all sorts of people just enjoying a very pleasant setting.  Not only has this project cleaned up the lakefront but there have been improvements in adjacent areas of a positive nature.
